proposal.title: ZECpages Revival Proposal
proposal.description:
## Introduction: Background and relevant experience.

Software Engineer with 8 years’ professional experience working in web and app development. Extensive expertise in building full-stack apps, design systems and server management; most experienced with JavaScript and Java, familiar with the Rust ecosystem and have experience with Python. Founder of open-source organization [Elemental Design: Elemental Design System](https://github.com/elemental-design), [Elemental Zcash: Zcash Design System](https://github.com/elemental-zcash) and [Elemental Pay: Open-source Cryptocurrency Payment Processing Apps and Utilities](https://github.com/elemental-pay).

Developed Elemental Zcash, an open-source design system and component library for Zcash apps. As part of this, I created an experimental [Zingo Node.js library](https://github.com/elemental-zcash/zingo-node) – a JSON RPC interface for creating payment invoices and authenticating via Zcash memos.

Contributed to Free2Z by developing a redesign of the [search](https://github.com/free2z/zuu/blob/main/ts/react/free2z/src/components/FindSearchFilter.tsx) and [profile pages](https://github.com/free2z/zuu/blob/main/ts/react/free2z/src/components/DisplayCreator.tsx), together with a [table of contents](https://github.com/free2z/zuu/blob/main/ts/react/free2z/src/components/markdown/TableOfContents.tsx) anchor link system for Free2Z pages.

Active member of the open-source community. [Contributor to](https://github.com/macintoshhelper?from=2019-12-01&to=2019-12-31&year_list=1):

- [airbnb/react-sketchapp](https://github.com/airbnb/react-sketchapp/commits?author=macintoshhelper) – render React code to Sketch designs or component library
- [react-figma](https://github.com/react-figma/react-figma/commits?author=macintoshhelper) – render React code to Figma designs
- [lona/xd-file](https://github.com/Lona/xd-file/issues/1) – Adobe XD file manipulation utility for Airbnb’s Lona
- [styled-components](https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/commits?author=macintoshhelper) – one of the most-used React CSS-in-JS libraries
- [commaai/explorer](https://github.com/commaai/connect/commits?author=macintoshhelper) – annotator for self-driving car video footage

## Technical Approach: How you plan to modify ZECpages UI

I have already written a custom homepage feed and message posting UI for ZECpages: https://github.com/zpublish/platform . This frontend can be reused, it uses virtualised lists/lazy loading for improved performance, supporting page numbers as keys. Remaining tasks would be to:

- Fork the original codebase to ZecHub and I’d be happy to act as a repo maintainer, accepting community contributions
- Refactor the front-end to use Next.js App Router with `shadcn` and Tailwind
- Implement the legacy username/password authentication
- Can implement “Sign in with Zcash” authentication in the future to remove the need for emails/usernames and allow for passwordless authentication

## Hosting & deployment strategy

Self-hosted first deployment system: to minimise server costs and make it easier for anyone to deploy their own version of ZECpages and be able to pick and choose the architecture that they like (dedicated server, VPS, AWS, etc). An OVH VPS/dedicated server would be used for hosting the app.

- Implement Warp Sync RPC server for a much faster and more stable sync than using the original CLI watcher.
- Implement Zingo RPC in the future for features like `encryptmessage` which would be required for “Sign in with Zcash” or find an way to incorporate `encryptmessage` into Warp Sync.

This will be a lightwallet first approach, with the optional of hosting a lightwalletd server with a full node, to minimise hosting costs and make it easier for anyone to deploy their own ZECpages instance.

**Potential features that could be developed in the future would include:**

- Bluesky protocol support
- `nostr` support (authentication and/or protocol support)
- Free2Z support
- OAuth2 provider for API access to allow for third party apps to incorporate ZECpages support

## Estimated Timeline: Breakdown of project phases.

**4 weeks**

*Week 1:*

- Refactor ZPublish Next.js app to use App Router, `shadcn` and Tailwind
- Mock home page feed API with JSON data archived API data from ZECpages/[JSON mocks](https://github.com/zpublish/platform/blob/master/packages/components/data/zecpages_feed.json)

*Week 2 and 3:*

- Spike using Warp Sync RPC server as a replacement for the `zecwallet` RPC interface.
- As a fallback, use [`zingo-node`](https://github.com/elemental-zcash/zingo-node) or [Zingo RPC/CLI interface](https://github.com/elemental-pay/wallet-service/blob/main/packages/zec-rpc-gateway/zingolight/api/api.py) as a wallet daemon for listening to new memos and payouts.
- Refactor the original backend to use Next.js App Router API routes, or if this proves to be a lot of work, re-use the original backend with Knex.js and gradually migrate to using Supabase or Prisma

*Week 4:*

- Work on a moderation backend (delay posts and allow for blacklist intervention, for example via a GitHub PR to a memo ID blacklist JSON file)
- Deploy the Next.js app and backend to the old or new domain name
- Pending availability of the old post blacklist or manual review, publish all old ZECpages posts
- Refactor and deploy the zecpages-likes-payout-script as a cron job/Docker service

## Risks

Moderation – if an archive/dump of the old post blacklist isn’t available, then manual human review could be required for restoring all old posts.

Finding the best approach for a wallet listener: the original wallet listener together with a multi-container Docker setup can be used as a safe fallback if an RPC server with Rust bindings proves to be too much work.

It could be worth delaying the revival of the ZECpages likes payout and work towards implementing multi transaction QR codes pending wallet support, decentralising this process, avoiding temporary custody of funds and resulting in a faster and more stable experience.

## Budget Proposal


*Development*

$100 hour rate / 30% discount = $70 / hour

16 hours * 4 weeks = 64 hours

($70 * 64 hours) / $30 = **149.3 ZEC**

*Hosting*

OVH dedicated server

$23 / 12 months = $276

$276.84 / $30 = **9.2 ZEC**

**Total:** 158.5 ZEC


$30 used a low point ZEC price over the past months given volatility.

proposal.title: Proposal for Forking and Hosting an Enhanced Version of ZECpages
proposal.description:
Introduction

Full Stack JavaScript Developer | Python | Solidity | Rust | Kotlin

With 5+ years of experience in full-stack JavaScript development, I specialize in building dynamic and scalable web applications. I have strong expertise in React, Node.js, and Express, and am also proficient in Python and Solidity (for smart contracts). My experience includes contributing to the following projects:

- Swarm Desktop: https://github.com/amochuko/swarm-desktop/activity?ref=master
- Swarm Upload: https://github.com/amochuko/swarm-upload
- Livepeer API: https://github.com/amochuko/livepeer-api
- EthSwarm Examples: https://github.com/amochuko/ethswarm-examples-js/activity?ref=react-webpack
- Zechub Wiki: https://github.com/amochuko/zechub-wiki/activity?ref=main
- Creative Platform: https://github.com/amochuko/crtv3/activity?ref=main

These contributions highlight my involvement in decentralized technologies and blockchain-related development.


Technical Approach

1. Fork & Setup

I will fork the existing ZECpages repositories and set up a local development environment to replicate the current state. I will ensure all core functionalities (Zcash memo-based posts, wallet daemon, likes payouts) are migrated to use `zingo-cli`.

2. UI/UX Improvement

The frontend will be modernized using the latest web design principles and frameworks. I will:
Redesign the UI for improved user experience. Implement a fully responsive layout for compatibility across devices.
Use React and Tailwind CSS for a clean, modular design system.

3. Backend Enhancements

The backend will be enhanced for scalability and security:
I will maintain the wallet daemon to monitor Zcash transactions.
Optimize the database schema and transaction handling processes.
Continue the likes payout system using batched transactions.

4. Hosting & Deployment

I will recommend cost-effective hosting options and ensure easy deployment:
Use Docker for containerization and ensure smooth deployment with CI/CD pipelines.
Explore hosting solution with Akash Network based on scalability and cost-effectiveness.

5. Documentation

The codebase will be fully documented to encourage future contributions. Comprehensive instructions will be provided for self-hosting and for setting up the development environment.

Timeline

Phase 1: Forking & Initial Setup (1/2 week)
Goal: Fork the repositories, set up the project, and ensure the basic functionalities (Zcash transactions, posts) are working.
Tasks: Fork repositories, set up a local environment, and run tests to verify the core functionality of the platform.

Phase 2: UI/UX Redesign (1 weeks)
Goal: Implement the UI redesign and ensure responsiveness across devices.
Tasks: Focus on key improvements like layout, navigation, and user experience.
Note: I can start with the most essential elements and progressively enhance the UI during the project.

Phase 3: Backend Enhancements (1 weeks)
Goal: Enhance the backend, ensuring that wallet daemon functionality is properly integrated and optimized.
Tasks: Refactor backend logic, improve the wallet daemon to monitor Zcash transactions, and optimize database interactions.

Phase 4: Testing & Bug Fixes (1/2 week)
Goal: Perform thorough testing of both the frontend and backend.
Tasks: Unit testing, integration testing, bug fixing, and code review.

Phase 5: Hosting & Deployment (1/2 week)
Goal: Set up deployment pipelines, finalize hosting solution, and ensure smooth deployment.
Tasks: Set up cloud infrastructure with Akash Network, configure CI/CD pipelines, and deploy the application.

Phase 6: Documentation & Final Handover (1/2 week)
Goal: Document the project and ensure it's ready for open-source contributors.
Tasks: Provide clear, detailed documentation for setup, usage, and future contributions.

Total Estimated Time: 4 weeks

Budget Proposal

I estimate the total cost of this project to be $4,500 USD. 

This budget covers:

Developer time: 71 hours at $60/hour = $4,260
Hosting: $240

Total cost: $4,500 USD
Total in Zcash (ZEC): 140.625 ZEC

proposal.title: ZECPages 2.0
proposal.description:
# ZECPages 2.0: A Modernised Zcash-Powered Message Board

## Introduction
ZECPages is a unique Zcash-powered message board that leverages shielded memo transactions for micro-transaction-based interactions. As a proof-of-concept, it has served as a valuable tool for the Zcash ecosystem, providing a directory, wallet sync performance benchmarking, and a public verifiable view-key for historic Zcash transactions. With **ZECPages 2.0**, we aim to preserve and enhance this platform by modernising its UI, improving backend efficiency, and ensuring seamless Zcash integration.

## Project Overview
ZECPages 2.0 will be a fork of the original ZECPages, retaining its core functionality while introducing significant improvements. The project will focus on:
- **UI Modernisation**: A refreshed, responsive, and user-friendly interface.
- **Backend Optimisation**: Enhanced performance and scalability.
- **Zcash Integration**: Continued use of shielded memo transactions for posts and payouts.
- **Open-Source Deployment**: Fully documented and accessible for community contributions.

## Technical Approach
### Frontend
- **Framework**: Continue using React for the frontend.
- **UI Improvements**:
  - Redesign the layout for better usability and responsiveness.
  - Implement a modern design system .
  - Add dark mode support for improved accessibility.
- **Features**:
  - Enhanced post filtering and search functionality.
  - User profiles with activity history.

### Backend
- **Framework**: Maintain Express.js and use MongoDB for the backend.
- **Optimisations**:
  - Refactor database queries for improved performance.
  - Implement caching mechanisms to reduce load times.
  - Ensure robust error handling and logging.
- **Zcash Integration**:
  - Continue using `zecwallet-cli` and the wallet daemon for transaction monitoring.
  - Improve the “likes” payout system with more efficient batched transactions.

### Hosting & Deployment
- **Hosting Solution**: Recommend using **Namecheap** for its cost-effectiveness and scalability.
  - Deploy using Docker containers for easy setup and maintenance.
  - Use managed MongoDB for database hosting.
- **Documentation**:
  - Provide detailed setup and deployment guides.
  - Ensure the repository includes a comprehensive README and contribution guidelines.

## Estimated Timeline
1. **Phase 1: Planning & Setup (1 week)**
   - Fork and review existing repositories.
   - Set up development environment and hosting infrastructure.
2. **Phase 2: UI Modernization (1 week)**
   - Redesign and implement the new frontend.
   - Conduct user testing and iterate on feedback.
3. **Phase 3: Backend Optimization (2 weeks)**
   - Refactor and optimize backend code.
   - Implement caching and performance improvements.
4. **Phase 4: Zcash Integration & Testing (2 weeks)**
   - Enhance wallet daemon and payout system.
   - Conduct thorough testing on testnet and mainnet.
5. **Phase 5: Deployment & Documentation (1 week)**
   - Deploy the platform to production.
   - Finalize documentation and open-source the project.

## Budget Proposal
- **Development**: 10ZEC (based on hours and complexity).
- **Hosting**: $200/year (Namecheap estimated costs).
- **Contingency**: 5ZEC (for unforeseen expenses).

## Why Choose Us?
- **Experience**: Proven track record in blockchain development and Zcash integration.
- **Commitment**: Dedicated to open-source principles and community-driven projects.
- **Vision**: Passionate about advancing the Zcash ecosystem through innovative tools like ZECPages 2.0.
- **Extra points**: I’ve done 2 bounties for Zechub perfectly.

We look forward to collaborating with the Zcash community to bring ZECPages 2.0 to life!

---

**Contact Information**:
- Email: [uwadiegwu.emmanuel48@gmail.com](mailto:uwadiegwu.emmanuel48@gmail.com)
- Discord: appinspire_88140
- GitHub: [Manuelthegoat](https://github.com/manuelthegoat)

proposal.title: ZecHub Research SubDAO
proposal.description:
ZecHub Research is a community-driven initiative focused on improving Zcash adoption by researching on/off-ramp solutions, usability barriers, and actionable strategies. We deliver open-source insights to empower developers, exchanges, and users.

Key Focus: 
- Privacy-first ramp analysis
- Global accessibility recommendations 
- Community-backed research

Join us: Contribute, collaborate, or critique.

proposal.title: ZecHub Research SubDAO Request
proposal.description:
📃 Summary

The ZecHub Research SubDAO is proposed as a dedicated research effort with a mission to improve the usability and accessibility of Zcash by conducting concentrated research on on/off ramp solutions. The project will be a value-add to the Zcash ecosystem, delivering quality, evidence-based research that can be used to inform strategic decision-making and encourage the adoption of privacy technology.

This SubDAO will fortify the research underpinning by providing developers with insightful, tangible depths of understanding, facilitating the growth of innovation and continuous enhancement through the Zcash ecosystem. This is aligned with Zcash's mission to advance financial privacy and decentralization while further cementing ZecHub's role as a knowledge hub.

🖨️ Problem Statement

The current landscape as several challenges that hinder Zcash adoption and growth:

1. Lack of Research on On/Off Ramps: There is not enough in-depth research on the usability and effectiveness of existing on/off ramp services that enable Zcash, limiting user adoption and access.
2. Outdated Insights: The dynamic nature of the cryptocurrency market demands real-time data-driven insights. The absence of a specific research mechanism results in missed opportunities for timely interventions.
3. Fragmented Research Activities: Current research activities are generally fragmented, with no central platform for sharing knowledge and collaboration among researchers.
4. Inequitable Compensation Mechanisms: Undercompensation of effort in the research ecosystem discourages participation by competent researchers, lowering the likelihood of worthwhile projects.

To address these challenges, the ZecHub Research SubDAO will focus on:

1. Conducting a detailed analysis of on/off ramp solutions for Zcash.
2. Providing actionable recommendations to enhance usability and accessibility.
3. Creating equitable contribution schemes for contributors.
4. Creating opportunities to collaborate with influential stakeholders for ensured research impact.

📜 Mission & Values Alignment

Mission

The mission of the ZecHub Research SubDAO is to generate high-quality research that informs and accelerates the adoption of Zcash, with a focus on enhancing privacy and accessibility.

Values

1. Integrity: Conducting research openly and honestly to build trust within the community.
2. Collaboration: Promoting collective efforts to achieve comprehensive and robust insights.
3. Responsibility & Accountability: Promoting transparent processes and fair remuneration for all contributors.
4. Innovation: Unrelenting exploration of new methodologies and technologies in privacy and decentralized finance.

👥 Core Team & Collaborators

This initiative is driven by a team of contributors with proven experience in blockchain research and community collaboration, forged through joint projects at BanklessDAO:

ETrinity007 (Research Lead), with my experience designing community-driven research frameworks. My work will focus on synthesizing technical insights into actionable strategies, a skill refined through collaborative projects at my previous organizations like BanklessDAO, TestDAO, RnDAO and so on.

Freedominant (Marketing Lead), whose expertise in decentralized community storytelling will ensure our findings resonate across diverse audiences. At BanklessDAO, Freedominant and I partnered on content campaigns, where his ability to simplify complex topics helped onboard thousands of users to the organization and its ecosystem.

MartinBlu(Data Analyst) brings a methodical approach to analytics, specializing in identifying actionable trends from fragmented datasets. Having collaborated at BanklessDAO on studies, I’ve witnessed their knack for balancing technical rigor with practical applicability……a critical skill for evaluating on/off ramp ecosystem.

Chameleon(Community Liaison), a facilitator skilled in bridging insights with grassroots feedback. Our prior work together at BanklessDAO on governance proposals demonstrated Chameleon’s talent for fostering inclusive dialogues, ensuring research remains grounded in real user needs.

This team’s foundation was built during collaborative efforts at BanklessDAO, where we collectively delivered projects balancing privacy, usability, and decentralized governance. While our past work spanned broader ecosystems, we’ll now love to channel that experience into Zcash-specific challenges. Our established communication rhythms and shared commitment to ethical research will allow us to operate efficiently while maintaining community trust.

🔠In-Depth Workstream Plan & Recommended Research Topics

Research Project: Navigating On/Off Ramps for Zcash

Objective: Analyze current on/off ramp services (exchanges, OTC desks) supporting Zcash, evaluating their effectiveness, privacy features, and user experience.

Key Areas of Investigation:

1. Identify all services supporting Zcash, including major exchanges like Coinbase and KuCoin.
2. Compare features such as fees, transaction speed, privacy (shielded transaction support), and geographical availability.
3. Assess user experience through surveys and reviews.
4. Evaluate regulatory compliance and barriers.
5. Recommend enhancements, including potential partnerships or technological upgrades.

🧪Methodology:

1. Desk research to compile a list of services and analyze their offerings.
2. Surveys distributed to Zcash users for feedback on their experiences.
3. Interviews with exchange representatives for insights.
4. Data analysis using tools for visualizations and trends.
5. Reporting to produce a comprehensive report with actionable recommendations.

📦Deliverables:

1. A detailed report on the on/off ramp landscape for Zcash.
2. Recommendations for improving accessibility and usability.
3. A presentation for community engagement.

🏦 Budget Allocation (Monthly)

The initial budget for this focused research project is $1,100 allocated as follows:

- Research Lead Compensation: $300
- Data Analyst Compensation: $250
- Community Liaison and Writer Compensation: $200
- Marketing Lead Compensation: $250
- Miscellaneous Expenses(Ambassadors): $100

This budget is designed to be cost-effective while ensuring fair compensation for team members.

🗓️ Timeline

- Months 1-2: Form the SubDAO, recruit the team, and plan the research.
- Months 3-4: Conduct desk research, surveys, and interviews.
- Month 5: Analyze data and draft the report.
- Month 6: Finalize the report, present findings to the community, and evaluate the project.

Total duration: Approximately 6 months, scalable based on progress.

🪜  Next Steps

1. Share this proposal for community feedback on Discord.
2. Finalize the proposal with input from the community and submit it for governance voting 
3. Upon approval, we will start implementing the project by recruiting the team and initiating research activities.
4. Plan future projects based on outcomes, potentially collaborating with other community.

📈 Community Benefits

The ZecHub Research SubDAO will provide significant benefits to the Zcash community, including:

- Better On/Off Ramp Knowledge: By conducting thorough research, we will improve the community's knowledge of available services, ultimately leading to better accessibility for Zcash users.
- Data-Based Recommendations: We will attract more exchanges to support Zcash, thus raising adoption and use.
- Community Engagement: Through surveys and outreach, we will encourage collaboration and make sure that community voices are included in the research process.
- Foundation for Future Research: This initial project will set the stage for future research, including researching stablecoin integration and what it entails for Zcash.

📁 Conclusion

The ZecHub Research SubDAO will significantly influence the Zcash ecosystem by focusing on important research areas that promote usability and accessibility. With a clearly defined budgets, a structured approach, and commitment to community participation should inspire this innovation and enable privacy-tech adoption, ultimately benefiting the wider Zcash community.

proposal.title: PayWithZ.cash Redesign & Transition to Next.js Framework
proposal.description:
**Introduction**

I am SpeedFox, a Web2/Web3 developer with over 5 years of experience in full-stack JavaScript development. My expertise spans React, Node.js, Express, Next.js, Nest.js, Python, Solidity, and intermediate skills in Rust and Kotlin. I am also an open-source contributor to projects like:

   - **Swarm Desktop:** https://github.com/amochuko/swarm-desktop/activity?ref=master
   - ** Livepeer API:** https://github.com/amochuko/livepeer-api
   - ** EthSwarm Examples:** https://github.com/amochuko/ethswarm-examples-js/activity?ref=react-webpack
   - ** Zechub Wiki:** https://github.com/amochuko/zechub-wiki/activity?ref=main
   - ** Creative Platform:** https://github.com/amochuko/crtv3/activity?ref=main

**Technical Approach**

1. **Redesign & Maintenance:**
   The project will transition from WordPress to a modern tech stack using Next.js, enhancing performance, flexibility, and security. SpeedFox will oversee development and ensure ongoing maintenance, including pull request reviews, bug fixes, and feature updates.

2. **Benefits of Next.js & Open Sourcing:**
   - **Performance & SEO:** Fast load times and better SEO with SSR and SSG.
   - **Flexibility:** More control over design and features, avoiding WordPress bloat.
   - **Open Source Community:** Fosters collaboration, innovation, and increased visibility.
   - **Security:** Reduces risks associated with WordPress plugins and outdated themes.

3. **Custom CMS:**
   A lightweight CMS will be built for easy content creation and moderation:
   - **Admin Dashboard**: Manage content and roles.
   - **PostgreSQL DBMS**: For scalable data storage.
   - **CRUD Operations & Moderation**: Control over content creation and approval.
   - **JWT Authentication**: Secure admin login.

4. **Development Timeline:**

   - **Week 1**: 

     - Days 1-2: 
       - Conduct an analysis of the current web app to identify key areas for improvement and migration requirements.
       - Design and implement the PostgreSQL database, including tables for content, users, and posts. Migrate necessary data from the existing system, ensuring smooth integration with the new setup.
       - Set up the Next.js framework and establish the project structure, ensuring scalability and optimal performance. 

     - Days 3-7: 
       - Develop core modules using Test Driven Development (TDD) approach, including content management (CRUD), dashboard, user authentication, and moderation features. Ensuring the dashboard is user-friendly and secure, allowing easy content management and admin oversight.


5. **Hosting & Deployment:**
   The web app will be deployed on Vercel for optimal performance and easy scaling.

6. **Cost Breakdown:**
   - **Development Costs**: $45/hour * 35 hours = $1575 (52.5 ZEC)
   - **Hosting Costs**: $23/month * 12 = $276 (9.2 ZEC)
   - **Total**: $1851.84 (61.7 ZEC)


**Conclusion**

The transition to Next.js will improve app performance, flexibility, and security, with a custom CMS for efficient content management. Open-sourcing the project encourages community collaboration. The total cost is 61.7 ZEC, covering development and hosting, with payment due upon completion.

proposal.title: Open-source paywithz.cash Redesign With Merchant Map
proposal.description:
## Introduction: Background and relevant experience.

Software Engineer with 8 years’ professional experience working in web and app development. Extensive expertise in building full-stack apps, design systems and server management; most experienced with JavaScript and Java, familiar with the Rust ecosystem and have experience with Python. Founder of open-source organization [Elemental Design: Elemental Design System](https://github.com/elemental-design), [Elemental Zcash: Zcash Design System](https://github.com/elemental-zcash) and [Elemental Pay: Open-source Cryptocurrency Payment Processing Apps and Utilities](https://github.com/elemental-pay).

Developed Elemental Zcash, an open-source design system and component library for Zcash apps. As part of this, I created an experimental [Zingo Node.js library](https://github.com/elemental-zcash/zingo-node) – a JSON RPC interface for creating payment invoices and authenticating via Zcash memos.

Contributed to Free2Z by developing a redesign of the [search](https://github.com/free2z/zuu/blob/main/ts/react/free2z/src/components/FindSearchFilter.tsx) and [profile pages](https://github.com/free2z/zuu/blob/main/ts/react/free2z/src/components/DisplayCreator.tsx), together with a [table of contents](https://github.com/free2z/zuu/blob/main/ts/react/free2z/src/components/markdown/TableOfContents.tsx) anchor link system for Free2Z pages.

Active member of the open-source community. [Contributor to](https://github.com/macintoshhelper?from=2019-12-01&to=2019-12-31&year_list=1):

- [airbnb/react-sketchapp](https://github.com/airbnb/react-sketchapp/commits?author=macintoshhelper) – render React code to Sketch designs or component library
- [react-figma](https://github.com/react-figma/react-figma/commits?author=macintoshhelper) – render React code to Figma designs
- [lona/xd-file](https://github.com/Lona/xd-file/issues/1) – Adobe XD file manipulation utility for Airbnb’s Lona
- [styled-components](https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/commits?author=macintoshhelper) – one of the most-used React CSS-in-JS libraries
- [commaai/explorer](https://github.com/commaai/connect/commits?author=macintoshhelper) – annotator for self-driving car video footage

## Technical Approach

Homepage with searchable merchant list and a physical merchant map to replace the ATM map page.

I have already created a JSON database of all the merchants from `paywithz.cash`: https://github.com/ZecHub/paywithzcash/pull/1/files . This can be easily ported to a mix of markdown/MDX/JSON files to be consumed by [Content Collections](https://www.content-collections.dev/).

- Create a Next.js app in the `paywithzcash` repository
  - I’d be happy to act as a repo maintainer going forward, accepting community contributions
- Implement [Content Collections](https://www.content-collections.dev/) to allow for contributions to markdown/mdx files via GitHub. This eliminates the need for a backend, reducing hosting costs and making contributions more accessible.
- Use Next.js App Router with `shadcn` and `tailwind-css`
- Use `react-map-gl` with `maplibre-gl` for interactive merchant map with cluster markers

A backend wrapper over JSON/markdown GitHub PRs can be developed in the future if using GitHub PRs proves to be a barrier to contribution.

Existing merchant upvote counts can be imported; however I feel that restoring the functionality is not enough to justify requiring a full backend. If there is high demand for this functionality, it can be developed in the future, but it would make more sense to focus on working towards developing a process for Zcash ambassadors to represent merchant interest/outreach in specific countries/cities. They can then help keep track of whether merchants continue to accept Zcash.

Example merchant schema:

`merchants/favorites/Flexa.md`

```md
---
name: Flexa
url: https://spedn.io/
subtitle: Spend Zcash in person at Dunkin, Ulta Beauty, GameStop, Topgolf, Express, Petco, Office Depot, Nordstrom, Caribou Coffee, Bed Bath & Beyond, and AMC Theatres.
tags: "Dunkin", "Dunkin Donuts", "Baskin Robbins", "Caribou", "Caribou coffee", "coffee"
logo: ./logos/flexa.jpg
---
```

`merchants/physical/cafe/RedRockCoffeehouse.md`

```md
---
name: Red Rock Coffeehouse
subtitle: Locally owned coffeeshop in Boulder Colorado
tags: "coffee", "colorado", "boulder", "chai", "cafe", "local"
logo: ./logos/red-rock-coffehouse.jpg
pluscode: 2PPQ+8Q Boulder, Colorado, USA
address: 3325 28th St, Boulder, CO 80301, United States
coordinates: 40.03582541231773, -105.26053114146632
country: US
---
```

## Hosting & deployment strategy

The website can initially be a static HTML export generated with Next.js *static exports* to minimise hosting costs and allow for hosting on a CDN. The infrastructure will be self-hosting friendly if anyone would like to host a copy locally or on their own hardware/infrastructure.

The website would be hosted on CloudFlare Pages or GitHub Pages with CloudFlare used as a CDN. GitHub Actions would trigger new builds/deployments when changes/contributions are merged to `main`.

## Estimated Timeline: Breakdown of project phases

**4 weeks**

*Weeks 1 and 2:*

- Develop the initial Next.js app with a redesign, using `shadcn` and `tailwind-css`
- Migrate the merchant JSON data to markdown files
  - This could be automated with a Node.js script
- Deploy the Next.js app to the existing or new domain name

*Weeks 3 and 4:*

- Create the physical merchant map using `react-map-gl` and `maplibre-gl`
  - Virtualised clusters to improve performance
  - Add ATMs that support Zcash
  - Filtering by country/city
- Create contribution documentation and a process for adding, removing or updating existing merchants via GitHub. There should be a tag for the last date that someone verified that a merchant still accepts Zcash.

**Possible Future Improvements**

- Bounties for onboarding new merchants
  - This can be split between the person onboarding the merchant, and the merchant itself
  - Users could create RFPs/sponsor bounties for merchants that they frequent
  - Possible revenue source to fund future development for `paywithz.cash`
  - Bounties could also fund merchant discounts for paying with Zcash (e.g. a fund for 15% off for Zcash payments)
- Sponsored merchants
  - Another possible revenue source to fund future development
- Onboarding Zcash ambassadors for specific countries or cities
  - This will make maintaining the merchant list easier and allow for improved merchant outreach


## Budget Proposal


**Development**

$100 hour rate / 30% discount = $70 / hour

5 hours * 4 weeks = 20 hours

$70 * 20 hours = $1400

$1400 / $30 (ZECUSD) = 46.6 ZEC

**Hosting**

Free or negligible costs for static site hosting.

**Total:** 46.6 ZEC

Extensive expertise in building full-stack apps, design systems and server management; most experienced with JavaScript and Java, familiar with the Rust ecosystem and has experience with Python. Currently based in Eastern Europe.


**Proposal**

I propose adding @1337bytes to the DAO, to gain full voting rights and to become an active contributor to governance discussions.

proposal.title: ZcashArabia (Ambassador Program)
proposal.description:
Hello!

Project Summary
Zcash Arabia aims to establish a thriving Arabic-speaking community for Zcash by providing high-quality educational resources, engagement activities, and developer support. Our goal is to increase awareness, adoption, and development around Zcash in the MENA region.

Project Description
The Arabic Zcash Community Initiative is a dedicated effort to expand Zcash adoption, education, and development within the MENA (Middle East & North Africa) region. This initiative aims to bridge the gap between Zcash and Arabic-speaking users by providing localized educational resources, interactive learning tools, and direct developer support.

Project Goals
- Build an active Zcash community in the MENA region.
- Educate Arabic speakers about Zcash’s privacy features and real-world applications.
- Increase the accessibility of Zcash-related content through localization and translation.
- Enhance user engagement through interactive activities, contests, and webinars.
- Encourage discussions on blockchain privacy and financial security within the region.
- To establish and grow an Arabic-speaking community for Zcash, ensuring wider adoption and understanding of privacy-focused blockchain technology in the MENA region.
- Foster collaborations between Zcash and regional blockchain developers to create new privacy-focused solutions.

Why MENA is Important for Zcash?

Economic Diversification and Innovation: Countries like the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Saudi Arabia are actively diversifying their economies beyond traditional sectors. The UAE, for instance, has implemented innovation-friendly regulatory frameworks that promote cryptocurrency adoption while ensuring consumer protection. This approach has attracted numerous crypto enthusiasts and entrepreneurs to the region.

Youthful Demographics: Saudi Arabia, with approximately 63% of its population under the age of 30, boasts a young and tech-savvy demographic. This group is particularly open to experimenting with new financial technologies, including cryptocurrencies, making it a promising market for Zcash.

Regulatory Support: The UAE continues to experience rapid growth in the crypto space, driven by a combination of regulatory innovation, institutional interest, and expanding market activity. Between July 2023 and June 2024, the UAE received over $30 billion in crypto, ranking the country among the top 40 globally in this regard and making it MENA’s third-largest crypto economy.
The MENA region’s rapid adoption of cryptocurrencies, supported by favorable economic conditions and regulatory frameworks, underscores its importance for Zcash’s growth and outreach efforts.

Our team:
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1e54Hss4V3muLlY-JffkOFIDuNIaP9s4sHUTqC0M-S3E/edit?usp=sharing

Scope of Work:
1. Community Management
- Actively manage and moderate Zcash Arabia's X and Telegram channels.
- Engage with the community by answering questions, addressing concerns, and fostering discussions around Zcash.
- Maintain a welcoming and informative environment to attract and retain members.

2. Content Creation & Localization
- Translation & Dissemination: Translate the latest Zcash news, announcements, and research papers and share them on X and Telegram.

Monthly Content Deliverables:
- 3 articles covering Zcash technology, privacy features, and ecosystem developments.
- 2 videos explaining Zcash use cases, updates, or tutorials on using Zcash securely.
- 2 Twitter threads summarizing key topics, technical insights, or recent updates.
- 3 infographics to simplify complex topics and enhance user understanding.

3. Community Engagement Activities
- 1 Monthly Contest: Run engaging competitions such as quizzes, meme contests, or user-generated content challenges to boost participation.
- 1 Monthly Webinar: Organize and host an educational webinar featuring experts, developers, or community leaders discussing Zcash-related topics.
- Conduct AMAs sessions with community members and Zcash contributors to improve transparency and education.

Expected Impact:
- Establish a strong Arabic-speaking Zcash community.
- Increase awareness and adoption of Zcash within the MENA region.
- Increase number of new created wallets
- Provide educational resources tailored to Arabic speakers.
- Foster long-term engagement through interactive content and community-driven initiative

Past work for Zcash:
https://x.com/ZcashArabia
https://cryptoblarabi.com/?p=8280
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_R-MMivTtWg

Requested amount for 2 month : 50 ZEC (25 per month)

Conclusion:

Zcash Arabia will serve as a vital hub for Arabic speakers to learn, engage, and participate in the Zcash ecosystem. By combining content creation, community management, and strategic outreach, we aim to grow a thriving, informed, and active community dedicated to Zcash and its mission.

Thank you.

proposal.title: Zcash FUTO meetup
proposal.description:
Proposal: Hosting a Zcash Meetup at the Federal University of Technology Owerri (FUTO)

Introduction

The Federal University of Technology Owerri (FUTO) has demonstrated a growing interest in blockchain technology, as evidenced by recent events like the ICP DecaHack Cohort held in August 2024. This enthusiasm presents a unique opportunity to introduce Zcash—a leading privacy-focused cryptocurrency—to the FUTO community. By organizing a Zcash meetup, we aim to educate students and faculty about financial privacy, the technological innovations behind Zcash, and its practical applications in the evolving digital economy.


Objectives

1. Raise Awareness: Introduce the FUTO community to Zcash, emphasizing the importance of financial privacy in today's digital landscape.

2. Educational Engagement: Provide comprehensive insights into Zcash's technology, including its zero-knowledge proofs and shielded transactions.

3. Community Building: Foster a local community of Zcash enthusiasts and users within FUTO, encouraging collaboration and knowledge sharing.


Event Details

Event Name: Zcash Meetup @ FUTO

Proposed Date: 18th April, 2025

Venue: FUTO Main Auditorium.

Expected Attendance: 100+ students, faculty members, and blockchain enthusiasts

Duration: 4–6 hours


Activities

-Keynote speech on financial privacy and Zcash technology

-Live demonstrations on setting up and using Zcash

-Q&A sessions with blockchain experts

-Networking sessions

-Distribution of Zcash-branded merchandise (e.g., polos, stickers, refreshments)


Justification

The success of previous blockchain events at FUTO, such as the ICP DecaHack Cohort, indicates a receptive audience eager to explore new technologies. Furthermore, initiatives by Zcash Nigeria have successfully organized educational activities across Nigerian universities, demonstrating the effectiveness of such engagements in promoting cryptocurrency adoption and understanding. Hosting a Zcash meetup at FUTO aligns with ongoing efforts to expand Zcash awareness and adoption in Nigeria. 


Budget Estimate

The estimated cost for hosting a Zcash Meetup at FUTO can be broken down as follows:

Estimated Budget Breakdown:

1. Venue & Logistics – $100
Renting a hall at FUTO or an appropriate space, chairs, etc


2. 100 Custom Polos – $1000
A decent branded Zcash polo will cost  $10 each.


3. Refreshments (Snacks & Drinks) – $200
Estimated at $2 per person for soft drinks and snacks.

4. Marketing & Promotional Materials – $100
Flyers, banners, posters, stickers, social media ads

5. Speakers' Honorarium & Transport – $100
Covering transportation and token appreciation for guest speakers/trainers

6. Miscellaneous Costs – $100
Unexpected expenses (power backup, last-minute logistics, security, etc.)


Total Estimated Cost:

$1600 (40 ZEC), depending on quality and logistics

*I will be soliciting to ZCG and the Zcash team for 40-50 ZEC inorder to make this event a success*


Expected Outcomes

-Increased Awareness: A heightened understanding of Zcash and financial privacy among FUTO students and faculty.

-Skill Acquisition: Participants gain practical skills in using Zcash and understanding its underlying technology.

-Community Growth: Establishment of a Zcash-focused community within FUTO, contributing to the broader Zcash Nigeria network.

-Engagement with University Administrators: If successful, the event may encourage FUTO’s administration to integrate blockchain education into its curriculum or extracurricular activities.

-Encouraging Peer-to-Peer Transactions & Business Use Cases: Students may begin using Zcash for small transactions, savings, or even entrepreneurial ventures within the university.



Conclusion

Organizing a Zcash meetup at FUTO represents a strategic initiative to educate and engage the university community on the significance of financial privacy and the innovative solutions offered by Zcash. By leveraging the existing interest in blockchain technology at FUTO, this event can serve as a catalyst for broader adoption and understanding of Zcash within Nigeria.

proposal.title: Local Zcash Initiative: Lokoja Meetup Proposal
proposal.description:
## Background ##
Local Zcash is an initiative that started last year  REFERENCE (https://free2z.cash/Mr_Moosty/zpage/local-zcash-movement ) with the aim of replicating the "Solana All Star" model, a grassroots approach that has made Solana the dominant and most used cryptocurrency in the African region, particularly in Nigeria. This model focuses on targeting grassroots communities across the country through content localization and breaking language barriers via local meetups in rural areas, reaching people who need decentralized finance the most.

Due to limited community support and resource constraints, many of our initial goals could not be achieved last year. However, in 2025, we have reignited the movement with renewed energy to onboard as many users as possible to the Zcash ecosystem.
While Nigeria is already a key catchment area for Zcash adoption, we believe much more can be achieved. 
There is no better way to connect and onboard people than through in-person meetups. We recognize the existing Zcash Nigeria community is doing excellent work, and our aim is to complement their efforts by focusing specifically on organizing high-impact local events and meetups. 

## Our Progress So Far ##

### Localized contents on X: ###
https://x.com/Local_Zcash/status/1884277484159684926    
https://x.com/Local_Zcash/status/1885972940023316796    
https://x.com/Local_Zcash/status/1886025957716218307 

### Announced and onboarded Volunteers: ###

### Sponsored Volunteers to Solana All star event in Zamfara: ###
https://x.com/Local_Zcash/status/1893202246105477382

These are just a few of some of the things we have achieved so far. 

## Current Proposal: Zcash Meetup in Lokoja, Nigeria (North Central) ##
Lokoja, Nigeria has demonstrated significant cryptocurrency adoption rates in Nigeria, making it an ideal location for expanding Zcash awareness and usage. The city's tech-savvy population and growing interest in financial privacy solutions position it as a strategic hub for Zcash community building.

### Event Details ###

Venue:  TBA

Date : TBA 

### Financial Requirements ###
1. Venue rental: Secure space at a tech hub with good equipment like projectors, screens, Speakers e.t.c.

3. Zcash-branded merchandise: T-shirts, stickers, etc.

Total ZEC Requested: 45 $ZEC 

## Expected Outcomes ##
The Lokoja meetup will deliver several key benefits for the Zcash ecosystem with upto 80 - 100 Attendees including Experienced Speakers.

Financial Privacy Education: Introduce attendees to the importance of financial privacy in the digital age and how Zcash provides this solution


Practical Onboarding: Guide attendees through downloading Zcash wallets and conducting their first transactions


Community Growth:
Get attendees to subscribe to Zcash shielded newsletters, Facilitate joining Zcash community platforms and Create local support networks for new users.

Measurable Impact: We will track metrics including number of new wallets created, community memberships, and follow-up engagement

## Next Steps ##
Upon approval of this proposal, we will:

Then a proper plan / schedule of event is contained in the docs below:  
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NwvEGsABw_ATcysfyrheGa7nqdT2JRzK02qTO5NlUQU/edit?usp=sharing  

We welcome feedback on this proposal and look forward to contributing to Zcash adoption in Nigeria.

proposal.title: Increase DAO voting duration to 5 days
proposal.description:
### Background:

DAO members voting engagement has been limited due to the current 3-day voting duration. 



### Why?

- DAO members have limited time during any week to be available to participate in votes.

- DAODAO interface / Keplr wallet can sometimes throw errors preventing DAO members from voting. 

- 5 days allows sufficient time to research the proposal and question or interview the potential contributors. 



### Proposal 

Update the Single Choice Voting Config from 3 days to 5 days duration. 


### Action 

By voting 'Yes' you approve to change the Voting Config to 5 days.

proposal.title: Zcash Privacy Awareness and Education for Students in Europe
proposal.description:
### **Background**
Europe’s crypto market is expanding rapidly, with millions actively using cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana. Despite this growth, awareness of privacy-focused cryptocurrencies like Zcash—offering enhanced security and anonymity—remains limited. With millions of students across European universities, this project aims to position Zcash as a leader in privacy-centric blockchain technology. The initiative will emphasize Zcash’s ability to provide confidential, shielded transactions, a feature increasingly vital in a privacy-conscious digital world.

### **Why**
This project seeks to raise awareness of Zcash across European university campuses, targeting students and young professionals interested in privacy, digital currencies, and blockchain technology. Zcash’s shielded transactions make it ideal for those prioritizing confidentiality in digital payments. Through this initiative, we aim to onboard hundreds of students to the Zcash network, equipping them with practical skills—such as sending shielded payments—via wallets, privacy features, and real-world applications. Workshops and events will enable students to learn about and engage with Zcash meaningfully, driving mainstream adoption of privacy-focused cryptocurrencies.

### **Proposal**
This proposal outlines a plan to bring Zcash education to European universities, starting with a pilot in Athens through the Erasmus Greece Student Network (10,000+ students across Greece). Launching with recreational team activities like football—chosen for its cultural appeal in Athens—we will foster collaboration and connections. The initiative will scale to other European universities over time. Educational events will highlight privacy’s importance in the digital age and introduce Zcash’s ecosystem through hands-on workshops, discussions, and practical use cases. Unlike traditional workshops, recurring interactive events will ensure sustained engagement, build local communities, and create a pipeline of developers for the Zcash ecosystem.

### **Student Engagement**
Erasmus students are known for engaging in extracurricular activities, making this program a natural fit for their experience. By blending social activities with technical workshops, we will ensure students gain skills while strengthening community ties and collaborating on real-world projects, such as building a Zcash payment tool.

### **Expansion Strategy**
Beyond the Erasmus pilot, we will partner with universities and bootcamps to reach more students. Starting in additional Greek cities, we will expand across Europe, creating a student network that adopts Zcash for peer-to-peer transactions.

### **Project Structure & Format**
**Program Duration**: 2 Months  
**Bi-weekly Workshops**:  
#### **Pilot & Weekly Agenda**  
- **Recreational Activities (1 hour)**:  
  Casual events like football in Athens (free vs. typical €25 local event cost) to foster collaboration, with future iterations offering varied team activities for broader appeal.  
- **Introductory Workshops (1 hour)**:  
  - Overview of blockchain, cryptocurrencies, and Zcash’s privacy features  
  - Hands-on setup of Zcash wallets and shielded transactions  
  - Using Zcash for everyday purchases and comparing it to Bitcoin  

#### **Engagement Activities**
Informal events to encourage networking among students passionate about privacy, blockchain, and cryptocurrency.

#### **Survey and Feedback**
Post-workshop surveys to assess students’ understanding of Zcash, its privacy features, and interest in future use.

### **Funding Request**
**Requested Amount**: 70 ZEC (total for 2 months)  
**Budget Breakdown**:  
- One-time banner creation: 4 ZEC  
- Venue rent (4 events): 40 ZEC  
- Organization and management: 20 ZEC  
- Refreshments: 6 ZEC  

### **Team and Allocation**
- **Project Manager – Alreqeb**  
  *Experience*: Over 7 years in digital media and business development, skilled in building partnerships/ scaling communities and Zcash community member.  
  *Responsibility*: Project oversight, workshop organization, university liaison, and event execution.  
  *Link*: [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mohammed-alreqeb-8a4358131/)  

- **Event Planner – Mary**  
  *Experience*: Over 4 years as Local Event Coordinator for ESN Athens Hub.  
  *Responsibility*: Event logistics, attendance tracking, student outreach, and managing local partnerships.  
  *References*: [ESN Athens](https://www.instagram.com/esnathens.aueb/), [Coordinator ](https://www.instagram.com/esninathens/)  

### **Objectives & Impact**
- **Onboarding Students**: Educate 100+ students in the Athens pilot (with plans to scale across Europe) about Zcash’s benefits, privacy features, and applications.  
- **Privacy Awareness**: Highlight privacy’s role in the digital economy, focusing on payments and data security.  
- **Engagement**: Foster long-term engagement, targeting 50% of participants to continue using Zcash post-project.  
- **Feedback**: Collect insights on shielded transactions and wallet usability.

### **Milestones**
**Month 1**:  
- Outreach to 100+ students  
- Conduct introductory workshops on Zcash and privacy  
- Survey students on digital privacy and blockchain understanding  
**Month 2**:  
- Assist students in setting up Zcash wallets  
- Facilitate testing of shielded transactions  
- Ensure 20+ early adopters actively use Zcash wallets  
- Gather feedback on usability and adoption interest  
- Launch a community forum with 50+ members  

### **Post-Project Survey & Community Building**
- Survey participants on their Zcash experience  
- Launch a Telegram-based community forum for ongoing privacy and Zcash discussions  

### **Conclusion**
This project will empower students to adopt Zcash and advance its mission of financial privacy. Through workshops, hands-on learning, and community engagement, we will create an environment where students understand and use Zcash in daily transactions, driving the next generation of privacy-conscious users worldwide.

---
 Vote Yes to approve the Zcash Privacy Empowerment on Campus initiative!

* I’m currently running the DYKSeries with the help of Squirrel on X

Proposal 

I propose to officially join the DAO. In acquiring full voting rights, I shall contribute to governance discussions and participate in votes.

Action

A vote of "Yes" supports adding Kroy! as a new member, and if passes will execute an action adding him to the DAO.

proposal.title: Zcash Korea Ambassador Proposal (May~August)
proposal.description:
Introduction

Hello, this is Aiden.

Since February, I have been serving as the Korean Global Ambassador for Zcash.

First of all, I want to sincerely thank the ZecHub DAO members for supporting my activities over the past three months.

As many of you already know, South Korea is one of the countries with a strong enthusiasm for cryptocurrency.

It is home to major exchanges like Upbit (ranked 4th on CoinMarketCap) and Bithumb (ranked 19th).

Unfortunately, due to stricter crypto regulations in 2021, privacy coins like Zcash were delisted from all Korean exchanges.

However, the attitude of Korean politicians toward crypto has been changing recently, and the regulations are gradually being relaxed.

I believe it is important to continue sharing Zcash-related content in Korean until privacy coins can be listed again on local exchanges.

Here is a summary of my recent activities:

Korea Zcash X (Twitter) account

Followers: 12 (as of Feb 13, 2025) → 245 (as of Apr 18, 2025)

Managing Zcash Korea communities on KakaoTalk and Telegram

Writing blog posts about Zcash (e.g., Brave Wallet, Zashi user manual)


Proposal

My plan includes:

Providing timely Korean translations of Zcash updates

Increasing community interaction via social media and chat platforms

Organizing events and discussions to drive engagement and awareness


Compensation & Budget

Monthly Fee: $400

Total Budget (USD): $1,200 (for 3 months)


During the next three months, I also plan to host community events using part of the funding.

If you approve this proposal, I promise to continue working not for financial gain, but to help grow the Zcash ecosystem in Korea.

Thank you always.

proposal.title: Grant Proposal: Decentralized Identity (DID) Wallet
proposal.description:
1. Executive Summary:
We propose building a decentralized identity wallet that empowers individuals to manage and verify their credentials (e.g., age, citizenship, qualifications) on the blockchain without exposing sensitive personal data. The wallet leverages W3C Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs), Verifiable Credentials (VCs), and privacy-preserving blockchains like Zcash to create a secure, censorship-resistant identity layer for the internet.

2. Problem Statement:
Today’s digital identity systems are fragmented, insecure, and privacy-invasive:
- Users over-share data just to verify a single attribute (e.g., uploading an entire ID to prove age).
- Data breaches of centralized identity providers put millions at risk.
- Users lack control over their identity and how it’s shared or stored.
This creates a need for a trustless, self-sovereign identity system where users can prove credentials selectively and privately.

3. Proposed Solution:
We will develop a decentralized identity wallet that:
- Enables users to create and manage DIDs.
- Issues and stores Verifiable Credentials (VCs) in a user-owned wallet.
- Allows selective disclosure of attributes (e.g., “over 18” without sharing DOB).
- Uses Zcash or another privacy-focused chain to store proofs and anchor identity claims.
- Leverages smart contracts for credential verification without relying on centralized authorities.

4. Technical Architecture
Standards & Protocols:
- W3C Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs)
- W3C Verifiable Credentials (VCs)

Blockchain Infrastructure:
- Zcash Blockchain: For privacy-preserving proof anchoring
- Smart Contracts: For issuing and verifying credentials

Libraries & SDKs:
- SSI.js
- uPort or Civic SDK (depending on compatibility)
- Zcash APIs (for privacy and transaction handling)

Frontend (Wallet UI):
- Mobile-first progressive web app
- React Native or Flutter for cross-platform support

5. Use Case Example:
A user wants to access an online platform that requires age verification.
Using the DID wallet:
- They present a Verifiable Credential stating they are “18+”.
- The platform verifies this without ever seeing the user’s name, birthdate, or government ID.
- No central server stores this information — only the user controls it.

6. Milestones:
Milestone 1: Research & Architecture – DID/VC standard integration, blockchain selection finalized (Month 1)
Milestone 2: Smart Contracts – Credential issuance + verification contracts (Month 2)
Milestone 3: Wallet MVP – Mobile/web app with DID creation & credential storage (Month 3)
Milestone 4: ZK Integration – Proof of credential validity with Zcash privacy features (Month 4)
Milestone 5: Testing & Audit – Security audit, end-to-end testing (Month 5)
Milestone 6: Deployment – Public beta launch (Month 6)

7. Team:
 Inspire_s  – Solo Developer with expertise in Web3, Solidity, React, and identity protocols.

8. Funding Request
Amount Requested: As discussed and granted from Zcash team
Breakdown:
- Development: 60%
- Security Audits: 20%
- Infrastructure & Hosting: 10%
- Community Testing & Documentation: 10%

9. Impact:
- Advances privacy-first identity for the decentralized web.
- Empowers users globally, including those without traditional IDs.
- Builds a foundation for trustless, user-owned identity in DeFi, DAOs, social platforms, and beyond.

10. Sustainability Plan:
Post-launch, the project will explore;
- Transaction fees for credential issuance/verification
- Integration with partner platforms for monetization
- DAO-based governance to ensure community-driven evolution.

proposal.title: Zcash Ukraine Regional Community Initiative by Beyond
proposal.description:
Hello ZecHub community,

My name is Beyond, and I’m an active contributor to the privacy-focused Web3 ecosystem through my involvement with projects like Nym and Web3Privacy Now. I’m based in Ukraine, and I’d like to propose the launch of a Zcash Ukraine Regional Community Initiative to increase awareness, education, and practical usage of Zcash in Ukraine — a region where privacy-preserving technologies are becoming increasingly vital.

Project Summary

The Zcash Ukraine initiative aims to foster an active local community of Zcash users and advocates in Ukraine. Through educational content, social media outreach, and offline events, the initiative will spread awareness of the value of private digital payments and how Zcash helps protect financial autonomy in a time of growing government surveillance and financial censorship.

Why Ukraine?

Ukraine is currently at the crossroads of war, humanitarian crisis, digital transformation, and increasing financial scrutiny. Over the last year, we’ve seen:

Growing state-level monitoring of income, crypto transactions, and banking activity.

Increased adoption of cryptocurrencies as a hedge against inflation and capital restrictions.

A rising interest in tools for privacy and digital self-sovereignty, especially among activists, independent media, and freelancers.

This presents a critical opportunity for Zcash to establish itself as a go-to solution for confidential, secure, and censorship-resistant transactions.

Goals

Establish a Ukrainian-speaking Zcash community focused on privacy education and grassroots outreach.

Create consistent and localized content (Twitter, Threads, Instagram) about Zcash and its privacy features.

Host regular offline events to onboard new users and showcase real-world use cases of Zcash.

Represent Zcash at local crypto conferences and community hubs to increase visibility.

Scope of Work

Community Building & Social Media (Monthly)

Manage and grow presence on Twitter/X, Threads, Instagram, and Telegram.


Create and share:

4–6 educational posts (use cases, privacy tips, ZEC tools).

2 Twitter/Threads treads per month explaining Zcash concepts and ecosystem news.

2–3 visual assets (infographics, videos, carousels).

Community engagement through polls, discussions, and user Q&As.

In-Person Outreach (Every 6 Weeks)

Host 2 regional privacy meetups during the 3-month pilot period (10–20 participants each).

Previous experience: Nym Dnipro Workshop. [https://forum.nym.com/t/bitcoin-ua-nym-meetup-report/437]

Collaborate with local co-working spaces and crypto hubs.

Event Participation

Join crypto conferences with a Zcash presence (regional booths or side-events).

Past examples: Incrypted 2024 [https://forum.nym.com/t/incrypted-conference-nym-2024-event-report/421] , N-Crypto 2025 [https://forum.nym.com/t/report-on-n-crypto-conference-2025/1299].

Apply for additional support if needed for travel/booth costs.


Timeline: Pilot (3 Months)
June – August 2025

Monthly Content Creation

Bi-monthly Privacy Events

Weekly Community Engagement

One major conference appearance (pending external support)


Requested Funding

Total: 30–36 ZEC for 3 months
(≈ 10–12 ZEC/month)


This funding will cover:

Time commitment for full-spectrum content work and community moderation.

Organizational efforts for local meetups.

Onboarding and education sessions.

Basic equipment/software if needed (graphic/video tools, ads, etc.).


Expected Outcomes

Build and activate a regional Zcash-supportive community in Ukraine.

Expand the reach of Zcash to new users, especially privacy-minded individuals.

Lay the foundation for long-term Zcash presence in Eastern Europe.

Deliver high-quality, engaging, and region-specific content.

Support Zcash’s global brand as a champion of financial privacy.


About Me (Beyond) [https://x.com/Beyond_Karto]

I’m a privacy advocate and Web3 educator, with hands-on experience running community workshops and events. My past work includes collaborations with:

Nym [https://nym.com/] — protocol for privacy-enhanced networking.

Web3Privacy Now [https://academy.web3privacy.info/] — open educational platform.

Organizer of privacy workshops in Dnipro and speaker at Ukrainian crypto events.

With your support, I’d love to build an active and self-sustaining Zcash community in Ukraine.

proposal.title: ZcashArabia (Ambassador - June to August)
proposal.description:
Hello!

Project Summary
Zcash Arabia aims to establish a thriving Arabic-speaking community for Zcash by providing high-quality educational resources, engagement activities, and developer support. Our goal is to increase awareness, adoption, and development around Zcash in the MENA region.

Project Description
The Arabic Zcash Community Initiative is a dedicated effort to expand Zcash adoption, education, and development within the MENA (Middle East & North Africa) region. This initiative aims to bridge the gap between Zcash and Arabic-speaking users by providing localized educational resources, interactive learning tools, and direct developer support.

Project Goals
Continue building an active Zcash community in the MENA region.
Educate Arabic speakers about Zcash’s privacy features and real-world applications.
Increase the accessibility of Zcash-related content through localization and translation.
Enhance user engagement through interactive activities, contests, and webinars.
Encourage discussions on blockchain privacy and financial security within the region.
To establish and grow an Arabic-speaking community for Zcash, ensuring wider adoption and understanding of privacy-focused blockchain technology in the MENA region.
Foster collaborations between Zcash and regional blockchain developers to create new privacy-focused solutions.

Why MENA is Important for Zcash?

Economic Diversification and Innovation: Countries like the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Saudi Arabia are actively diversifying their economies beyond traditional sectors. The UAE, for instance, has implemented innovation-friendly regulatory frameworks that promote cryptocurrency adoption while ensuring consumer protection. This approach has attracted numerous crypto enthusiasts and entrepreneurs to the region.

Youthful Demographics: Saudi Arabia, with approximately 63% of its population under the age of 30, boasts a young and tech-savvy demographic. This group is particularly open to experimenting with new financial technologies, including cryptocurrencies, making it a promising market for Zcash.

Regulatory Support: The UAE continues to experience rapid growth in the crypto space, driven by a combination of regulatory innovation, institutional interest, and expanding market activity. Between July 2023 and June 2024, the UAE received over $30 billion in crypto, ranking the country among the top 40 globally in this regard and making it MENA’s third-largest crypto economy. The MENA region’s rapid adoption of cryptocurrencies, supported by favorable economic conditions and regulatory frameworks, underscores its importance for Zcash’s growth and outreach efforts.

Scope of Work:
- Collaborating with other local and regional communities to amplify our efforts and share resources and doing cross-events.
- Engaging with Arab exchanges to explore the listing of ZEC, which would help increase liquidity, accessibility, and demand across the region.
- Creating a dedicated website for ZcashArabia to serve as a hub for translated announcements, post original educational articles, and guides focused on Zcash and privacy. Over time, this platform will evolve to offer comprehensive Arabic-language courses for both users and developers, ensuring deeper technical understanding and adoption.

Community Management
Actively manage and moderate Zcash Arabia's X and Telegram channels.
Engage with the community by answering questions, addressing concerns, and fostering discussions around Zcash.
Maintain a welcoming and informative environment to attract and retain members.
Content Creation & Localization
Translation & Dissemination: Translate the latest Zcash news, announcements, and research papers and share them on X and Telegram.

Monthly Content Deliverables
3 articles covering Zcash technology, privacy features, and ecosystem developments (Will be posting as a press release)
2 videos explaining Zcash use cases, updates, or tutorials on using Zcash securely.
2 Twitter threads summarizing key topics, technical insights, or recent updates.
3 infographics to simplify complex topics and enhance user understanding.

Community Engagement Activities
1 Monthly Contest: Run engaging competitions such as quizzes, meme contests, or user-generated content challenges to boost participation.
1 Monthly Webinar: Organize and host an educational webinar featuring experts, developers, or community leaders discussing Zcash-related topics.
Conduct AMAs sessions with community members and Zcash contributors to improve transparency and education.

Expected Impact:
Establish a strong Arabic-speaking Zcash community.
Increase awareness and adoption of Zcash within the MENA region.
Increase number of new created wallets
Provide educational resources tailored to Arabic speakers.
Foster long-term engagement through interactive content and community-driven initiative

Past work: https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcasharabia-report/50873

Requested amount for 3 months : 60 ZEC (20 ZEC per month)

Conclusion:
Zcash Arabia will serve as a vital hub for Arabic speakers to learn, engage, and participate in the Zcash ecosystem. By combining content creation, community management, and strategic outreach, we aim to grow a thriving, informed, and active community dedicated to Zcash and its mission.

Thank you.

proposal.title: Zcash Luma Calendar Management
proposal.description:
Introduction

Content Writer | Graphics Artist | Community Contributor with 3 - 4 years of experience in content creation and visual communication, I specialize in managing digital content with clarity and consistency. I have actively contributed to the Zcash ecosystem by maintaining and updating the Zcash Luma calendar for two consecutive months. This role has helped me gain a solid understanding of community needs, key events, and the importance of visibility for both internal and external stakeholders.

In addition to my creative background, I take pride in ensuring that every calendar entry is accurate, timely, and reflective of the values of the Zcash community.

Technical Approach - Ongoing Calendar Management

Content Updates: I will continue to add upcoming events, AMAs, community calls, Zcash protocol updates, and any relevant happenings in the ecosystem.
Verification: Each entry will be verified for accuracy before publication. Event links, time zones, and descriptions will be double-checked.
Consistency: All calendar entries will follow a uniform format, ensuring clarity and professionalism across all updates.
Visual & UX Considerations & Event Thumbnails: I will create or adapt simple, branded visuals for recurring events to enhance the visual appeal of the calendar.
Categorization: Events will be organized under clear categories such as Development, Community, Governance, etc., making the calendar easier to navigate.
Community Coordination - Communication: I’ll liaise with community leaders, developers, and ecosystem partners to ensure their events are included in a timely fashion.
Feedback Loop: I will stay responsive to community feedback and adjust formatting or update frequency as needed.

Timeline

This is an ongoing task with weekly attention. I propose continuing calendar management on a monthly cycle, with weekly reviews and updates. This will include:
-Weekly checks and updates
-Advance scheduling of known events
-Visual touch-ups (if applicable)
-Sync with Zcash social/community platforms when needed.

Budget Proposal

I propose a flat monthly rate of $110 to  continue managing and updating the Zcash Luma calendar. 
This covers: Calendar updates and event research, Communication with stakeholders, Visual consistency and formatting, Timely and verified additions for at least four weeks per cycle

Conclusion
Maintaining an up-to-date and visually organized Zcash Luma calendar strengthens the community's awareness and participation. Given my track record and ongoing commitment, I am confident in my ability to continue providing value in this role.

Thank you for your consideration.

Engage with the community by answering questions, addressing concerns, and fostering discussions around Zcash. Maintain a welcoming and informative environment to attract and retain members. Conduct AMAs sessions with community members and Zcash contributors to improve transparency and education.

Expected Impact: Establish a strong Arabic-speaking Zcash community. Increase awareness and adoption of Zcash within the MENA region. Increase number of new created wallets Provide educational resources tailored to Arabic speakers. Foster long-term engagement through interactive content and community-driven initiative

By combining content creation, community management, and strategic outreach, we aim to grow a thriving, informed, and active community dedicated to Zcash and its mission.
