proposal.title: Zcash Ghana Initiative: Advancing Financial Privacy, Education, and Business Integration
proposal.description:
OVERVIEW
The Zcash Ghana Initiative is a grassroots, multi-stakeholder movement aimed at creating a self-sustaining ecosystem for the adoption and use of Zcash, a leading privacy-focused cryptocurrency in Ghana. Through local education, business onboarding, developer outreach, and content localization, this initiative seeks to empower Ghanaians with tools to transact freely, securely, and privately.
We are committed to building a Ghanaian Zcash ecosystem from the ground up starting with a regional community hub, merchant integrations, and consistent educational programming in English, Twi, and other relevant local languages.
Why Zcash Privacy Adoption Is Urgently Needed in Ghana
1. Increasing Financial Surveillance
While Ghana is considered one of Africa's more open democracies, there is a growing digital footprint tied to mobile money, bank accounts, and tax systems. With rising integration between banking systems and identity databases, Ghanaians are increasingly subject to unconsented financial tracking.
As the government pushes digital taxation, social security registration, and mobile identity verification, Zcash offers a critical tool to preserve financial privacy and protect users from overreach or future abuse.
2. High Mobile Money Penetration Without Privacy
Ghana is among the top countries in Africa in mobile money usage, with over 40% of adults transacting via MTN Mobile Money, Vodafone Cash, or AirtelTigo. However, these platforms do not offer privacy because every payment is logged, analyzed, and often shared with third parties.
Zcash can complement mobile money by offering private peer-to-peer alternatives that are:
Fee-less or low-fee
Fast and censorship-resistant
Available without needing a bank or telco approval


3. Cash Depreciation and Inflation Pressure
Although relatively stable compared to some neighbors, the Ghanaian cedi has seen frequent depreciation, eroding citizens’ purchasing power. Zcash provides a borderless store of value and hedge, especially for freelancers, remote workers, and youth receiving crypto payments.
4. SMEs and Informal Sector Need Private Digital Tools
Ghana's economy is powered by millions of informal small businesses that conduct daily transactions. These merchants:
Often dealt with security risks when handling physical cash
Have no access to private digital alternatives
Need faster, cheaper, privacy-enhanced methods for handling transactions and accepting payments across borders
Integrating Zcash into their operations offers instant, private, secure digital payment infrastructure especially important for cross-border trade, wholesalers, and tech-savvy retail entrepreneurs.
5. Digital Youth Culture and Rising Tech Literacy
Over 57% of Ghana's population is under 25, and this youth segment is already exploring crypto through platforms like Binance, Yellow Card, and Paxful. Many are eager for:
Financial independence
Freelance income from abroad
Digital investment tools
Zcash appeals to this demographic because it’s privacy-first, open-source, and gives real control over their money.


Project Objectives
Educate Ghanaians about Zcash and the importance of financial privacy
Build a Zcash community in Ghana, with active Telegram and X (Twitter) presence, AMAs, and monthly webinars
Onboard real businesses and merchants in Accra, Kumasi, Tamale, Takoradi, and Cape Coast to accept Zcash
Engage exchanges and wallet providers to improve access and support for shielded transactions in Ghana
Collaborate with local developers and groups to build and experiment with privacy-preserving tools using Zcash
Localize Zcash knowledge through articles, videos, and live sessions in English and local languages
Launch ZcashGhana social media pages - a content and learning hub with tutorials, merchant listings, and translations


Scope of the Project
1. Business Integration: Bringing Zcash into Ghanaian Commerce
Identify and partner with 10+ small businesses (cafés, retail stores, eateries /food vendors, hotels, creative vendors, beauty salons, local logistics) to accept ZEC payments
Educate businesses on effectively using Zcash wallets with options of transparent and shielded transactions, understanding ZEC (Zcash cryptocurrency), and navigating centralized exchanges for seamless transactions and cashing out when needed.
Assist businesses in downloading and installing Zcash wallets on their mobile phones, desktops, or laptops, ensuring proper setup and security for smooth daily transactions.
Assist businesses in generating and printing Zcash wallet QR codes to enable quick, scan-based customer payments, along with providing basic Point of Sale (POS) support for seamless transaction tracking.
Provide Zcash-focused training and educating materials to educate business owners and staff, along with offering customer incentives in ZEC to encourage adoption and promote usage. 
Educate and onboard local businesses using Ghana local language.
Create video testimonials and case studies of merchants using Zcash and adopting the Zcash wallet.
Create and maintain a “Zcash Accepted Here” directory on ZcashGhana page to showcase local businesses that accept ZEC, helping customers easily find where they can spend their Zcash and encouraging wider adoption within the community


2. Strategic Partnerships
Partner with:


Crypto-friendly cafés, co-working spaces and Universities.
Communities in Ghana and neighboring regions focused on Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, and broader Web3 ecosystems—including decentralized applications (dApps), DAOs, NFTs, and DeFi platforms.


Tech hubs like MEST Africa, Kumasi Hive, iSpace


Local YouTubers, Tech innovators, Web3 educators, and Influencers.


Collaborate with regional Crypto and Web3 events to host Zcash Ghana booths or workshops, promoting ZEC adoption through hands-on education, wallet onboarding, live demonstrations, and community engagement.
3. Community Growth & Events
Monthly Meetups: Physical meetings, Hackathons and Zcash used cases project development as well as demonstration.
Telegram, Youtube, Twitter and Tiktok and Instagram Community (moderated in English & Twi)


Monthly Webinars: Featuring developers, merchants, or privacy advocates
AMA Sessions with Zcash Foundation members or community contributors
Monthly Contests: Memes, quizzes, or photo-based contests rewarding participants in ZEC




4. ZcashGhana Social media page  – Community and Education Hub  
Central website for:


Articles, tutorials, FAQs (in English and Twi)
Translated announcements from the Zcash ecosystem
Business onboarding kits
Event calendar and webinar registration
Local merchant map


5. Educational Content & Localization (Monthly content pipeline:)
2 Original Articles: E.g. “Why Privacy Matters in Africa”, “How to Set Up a Zcash Wallet in Ghana”, “Zcash vs Traditional Banking”
2 Short Videos: Animated explainers, business use case spotlights, privacy tutorials
2 Twitter Threads: Highlighting updates, simplified tech breakdowns, or cultural perspectives
2 Infographics: Simple visuals on privacy, shielded vs transparent addresses, how to accept Zcash in stores



Project Team Members
1. “ONOSE OGHENEVWOGAGA” with discord ID: ogasky 
He is a Blockchain Community Advocate and web3 project developer based in West Africa. He co-founded WittyHub, which is a member hub of the Innovation Support Network (ISN) and AfriLabs whose network of tech hubs cut across Africa and Ghana in particular. He has a family based in Ghana and he has hosted Zcash events in his hub, and has taken the Zcash awareness to universities and business places. Also he has hosted Blockchain events in Zambia, Uganda, Ghana and Nigeria. And in some of the events the turnout was over 100 persons and at times up to 500. He has visited some African countries and China as well for tech, web3 and AI related activities and of which he intends to leverage on this network to promote Zcash in Ghana and beyond. He has been a member of the Zcash community for almost 5 years now, and he believes in financial privacy.  See Profile and Contribution link here 

2. “AKINSANYA AYOMIDE FAVOUR” with discord ID: UknowZork
UknowZork is a Certified CopyWriter, Content Writer, Translator, Certified Ghostwriter, and Graphic Artist shaping stories and visuals in Web3. She has worked with projects like SingularityNET Ambassador Program contributing to content, infographics, 3D design, and Marketing community-driven initiatives. She is a passive active member of the Zcash community for a while now bridging creativity and blockchain, one project at a time. She also contributed to the Zcash Ecosystem Digest, translated the Traduccion Vol. news for the ZcashEsp community,  designed an infographics for the ZcashEsp community and currently, she’s in charge of the Zcash Luma calendar, a proposal that also passed with the Dao member votes.
She was certified by Google in October 2023 for successfully completing the fundamentals of digital marketing certificate examination. See contributions here,  See here, Link to profile here

3. “ADVANCEAMEYAW EMMANUEL with discord ID: advanceameyaw
Advanceameyaw Emmanuel is a developer with a growing portfolio in blockchain and AI integration. He’s based in Ghana and he has served as an ambassador for SingularityNet Ambassador Program, where he contributed to outreach and community development efforts around decentralized technologies. Currently, Emmanuel is actively involved in projects focused on bringing Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Artificial Superintelligence (ASI) to mainstream markets, reflecting his commitment to cutting-edge innovation and real-world tech applications.
As a longstanding member of the Zcash community, he has contributed to discussions, initiatives, and educational efforts aimed at promoting privacy-focused financial tools in the decentralized ecosystem.

4. “EJIRO ADENIYI” with discord ID: ejiro 
Ejiro is a skilled graphic designer and active member of the Zcash community, with a strong passion for privacy-focused projects and decentralized technologies. Ejiro’s work reflects a deep commitment to visual storytelling that supports and promotes the principles of digital privacy and financial sovereignty.
With a keen eye for design and a drive to contribute meaningfully to the Web3 space, Ejiro continues to lend her creative talents to initiatives that align with the core values of user empowerment, anonymity, and open-source collaboration. She is based in Ghana.

Our Team Structure
Project Coordinator (Lead): Overall management, partnership strategy, reporting
Community Manager: Daily engagement on Telegram & X, event moderation
Content Creator: Writes articles, threads, manages social media calendar
Translator (English–Twi): Converts materials into clear, educational content in local Ghanaian languages to support business owners facing language barriers, ensuring inclusive access to Zcash resources..
Merchant Integration Lead: Leads the onboarding of local businesses to accept Zcash (ZEC), providing hands-on support with wallet setup, QR code generation, basic POS tools, and ongoing assistance to ensure smooth payment experiences.
Designer & Editor: Designs engaging visual content including infographics, branding assets, and educational materials; also edits promotional videos to support Zcash campaigns and community outreach.
Web Developer: Responsible for creating, updating, and maintaining ZcashGhana Social media pages ensuring that it remains functional, user-friendly, and aligned with the project’s goals and community needs.  
Note: The tasks outlined above will be collectively managed by the four team members, with responsibilities shared based on expertise and availability


Expected Outcomes
10+ Ghanaian businesses accepting ZEC payments within 3 months
Over 1,000 Ghanaians reached monthly through Telegram and X as well as physical meetups.
Hundreds of wallets created, tracked through partner referrals and event demos
A fully functional ZcashGhana.org hub with localized resources and merchant listings
Community-led demand for shielded transaction support on local wallets and exchanges
A growing awareness of Zcash as a privacy-respecting, real-world solution for Ghanaians


Requested Budget (3-Month Cycle): $5,550 USD  
Category - Monthly 3 Months)
Content Creation (Articles, Threads & Publicity) - (1months) $200 - (3months) $600
Merchant Onboarding (Travel, POS Setup, Wallet Support) - (1months) $200 -(3months) $600
Events Venue, Equipment, Logistics & Events refreshments - (1months)$500 - (3months)$1500
Design & Infographics - (1months)$100 - (3months)$300
Video Coverage & Production - (1months)$150 - (3months)$450
Community Management & Administrative cost  - (1months)$600 - (3months)$1,800
Subscriptions, Data & Miscellaneous - (1months)$100 - (3months)$300
Total= (1months)$1,850 - (3months)$5,550

Conclusion
Ghana stands at a digital crossroads. With the right tools, its youth, businesses, and innovators can take control of their financial lives. Zcash provides a unique advantage—privacy by design.
This initiative is not only about awareness, but about real adoption, real utility, and real communities. By rooting Zcash within the everyday realities of Ghanaian life—from the roadside shop owner to the remote worker—we plant the seeds for a more private, inclusive digital economy.
Zcash Ghana is ready. Let’s build it.

proposal.title: Proposal: Zcash Ukraine Regional Community Initiative (September–November 2025)
proposal.description:
**Submitted by:** Beyond

---

### 👋 Introduction

Hello Zcash community,

My name is Beyond, and I’m the coordinator of the **Zcash Ukraine Regional Community Initiative**. Since June 2025, we’ve been actively building a Ukrainian-speaking community focused on privacy education and real-life adoption of Zcash.

We’ve already launched the first phase of the initiative with strong early traction. You can read our progress in the:

📄 [Monthly Report – June 2025](https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcash-ukraine-monthly-report-june-2025-by-beyond/51571)
📸 [Event Report – July 19 | Dnipro, Ukraine](https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/event-report-july-19-dnipro-ukraine/)

Now, I’m submitting this **proposal for continuation funding** to support and grow the Zcash Ukraine initiative from **September through November 2025**.

---

### 🌍 Why Ukraine?

Ukraine remains at the center of ongoing conflict, digital transformation, and rising surveillance. The demand for tools like Zcash is real and growing:

* **Crypto adoption** continues due to economic instability
* **Privacy awareness** is increasing among IT professionals, freelancers, and activists
* **Localized education** is missing, especially around financial privacy

We believe Zcash can play a critical role here — and we’re building the infrastructure for that.

---

### 🎯 Goals for Sep–Nov 2025

1. **Community Expansion**

   * Grow our Telegram, LinkedIn, and Instagram outreach
   * Share consistent localized Zcash content (use cases, wallet tutorials, privacy insights)
   * Run Q\&A sessions and AMAs in Telegram weekly

2. **Train “Privacy Masters”**

   * Select 3–5 committed local contributors
   * Provide training around ZEC, privacy, and onboarding
   * Help them implement Zcash in their personal/professional life (freelance, e-commerce, activism)

3. **Offline Activities (Monthly)**

   * Host 1 in-person event per month (Dnipro or other cities)
   * Formats: educational workshops, privacy games, small hackathons, or creative meetups (e.g., sports + privacy challenge)
   * Each event: \~10–20 attendees, practical ZEC onboarding

---

### 📅 Timeline Overview

| Month         | Focus                                        |
| ------------- | -------------------------------------------- |
| **September** | Wallet onboarding & digital hygiene workshop |
| **October**   | Privacy Game or Hackathon                    |
| **November**  | Final meetup + mini-graduation               |
| Weekly        | Community engagement, content publishing     |

---

### 📦 Deliverables

* 70+ content pieces per month
* 3 offline meetups (1 per month)
* Trained “privacy ambassadors”
* 150+ Telegram members
* Onboarded users with ZEC wallets
* Branded materials: t-shirts, stickers, banners

---

### 💸 Requested Funding

💰 **Total Requested: \~65 ZEC for 3 months**

| Item                                | USD     | ZEC                   |
| ----------------------------------- | ------- | --------------------- |
| Coordination, content, moderation   | 14 ZEC (Month)      | 42 ZEC                |
| Event costs (venue, drinks, etc)    | \$600   | 15 ZEC                |
| 15 branded t-shirts                 | \$200   | 5 ZEC                 |
| Promo materials (stickers, banners) | \$100   | 2.5 ZEC               |
| **Total**                           | \~\$900 | **64.5 ZEC → 65 ZEC** |

---

### ✅ Outcomes for the Zcash Ecosystem

* Stronger Ukrainian presence for Zcash
* Real-life ZEC usage by IT freelancers, store owners, and activists
* Long-term visibility via localized branding and SEO
* Expanded content library in Ukrainian
* Trained contributors who will continue ZEC advocacy

---

### 👤 About Me

**Beyond**

* Privacy & digital security educator
* Web3 community organizer (Nym, Web3Privacy Now)
* Coordinator of Zcash Ukraine since June 2025
* Twitter/X: [@Beyond\_Karto](https://x.com/Beyond_Karto)

---

### 🙏 Final Note

We’re moving forward — and momentum is real. The Ukrainian community is responding, and we want to build on what’s working.

With your support, we’ll continue onboarding, educating, and empowering users — making Zcash a visible and **practically used** tool for privacy in Ukraine.

Thank you for considering this proposal!
— **Beyond**

---

proposal.title: Launch ZecHub Namada Bounty Program
proposal.description:
## Background

ZecHub is a community-driven platform focused on education and adoption of Zcash and privacy technology. 

Namada is a cosmos privacy L1 strongly aligned with Zcash's values. Read Namada x Zcash Alliance: https://vknowable.github.io/knowable-blog/namada-zcash-alliance/

In preparation for the Namada Shielded Airdrop to Zcash holders, community building between ecosystems will be mutually beneficial. 

Towards our goal of becoming a Shielded Ecosystem platform we have launched a Penumbra Bounty Program and propose extending this to support Namada as well.  


## Why?

Bounty programs are an established way to incentivize community building & collaboration while promoting open-source contributions from across the world. This means:

- Extending Zechub’s educational and contributor base into Namada’s ecosystem.  
- Rewarding contributors directly in NAM/ZEC or other shielded assets to reinforce privacy-first usage.  
- Encouraging collaboration between Zcash and Namada communities.  
- Increasing visibility of Zechub as an education platform across ecosystems.  

## Proposal

ZecHub will establish a **Namada Bounty Program** to reward contributors with NAM tokens (Possibly ZEC / Other Shielded Assets). Bounties will include:  
- Writing guides, documentation, or tutorials about Namada.  
- Building out our Namada Wiki & dashboards. https://namada.zechub.wiki
- Increased Community outreach, event participation, or onboarding initiatives.  


## Action

By voting "Yes" you approve for:  
- ZecHub DAO to allocate a starting budget 25,000 NAM tokens for bounty distribution.  
- The dework Namada bounty board will be used to list community tasks.  https://dework.zechub.org
- DAO to review results on a monthly basis and adjust accordingly.

proposal.title: Community Grant Punchlist Proposal
proposal.description:
# Background
In our earlier proposal for a Zcash grant-tracking and progress platform ([link] https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/community-grant-punchlist-proposal/49254), budget concerns were raised. Since then, we’ve worked on similar systems across other networks and DAOs, streamlined the approach, and can now provide the solution for  **$3,500.**

Zerodart has already experimented with an alpha version of a grant-tracking dashboard. This initiative builds on that groundwork by delivering a production-ready version with automated milestone tracking, alerts, and backend support to ensure long-term reliability.”

# Summary
Build a dashboard to visualize Zcash community grants, allowing members to track progress transparently. The dashboard will be integrated into the Zcash Community Grants site, providing clear views of milestones, visual progress indicators, and alert mechanisms.

# Problem Statement
Currently, tracking Zcash grant progress can be challenging, with updates scattered across forum threads and limited transparency into milestone completion or delays. This lack of clarity can make it difficult for the community to assess progress, identify issues early, and understand potential deviations from grant scopes.

# Proposed Solution
Develop a **Grant Milestone Dashboard** that will:  
- **Track Individual Grants:** Each grant will have a detailed milestone list, with progress bars or percentage indicators for clarity.  
- **Provide Alerts:** Automatic alerts will flag delays or deviations from the approved scope.  
- **Offer Unified Access:** A single, user-friendly location for monitoring all active grants.  

# Budget Breakdown & Milestones

### Milestone 1: Design, Feedback & Frontend Development (2 weeks)  
**Cost: $1,000**  

**Activities:**  
- **Dashboard Design & Wireframes**  
  - Grant Overview Page: Displays a summary of all active grants with status indicators (e.g., % complete, “On Track,” or “Delayed”).  
  - Individual Grant Pages: Detailed view of each grant’s milestones, completion percentages, and timelines.  

- **Frontend Development**  
  - Build a responsive framework for desktop and mobile accessibility.  
  - Milestone Tracking: Grant milestones with status, completion bars, and estimated completion dates.  
  - Progress Indicators: Visual bars or percentage markers to show progress at both overall grant and individual milestone levels.  

---

### Milestone 2: Backend Development & Finalization (2 weeks)  
**Cost: $2,500**  

**Activities:**  
- Build a milestone tracking and data aggregation engine (GitHub, Forum, and Discord) with project views and live updates.  
- Add filterable dashboards, risk visualizations, treasury dashboard, and admin controls.  

**Alert System:**  
- Automatically flags and sends alerts for overdue milestones or deviations from the original scope.  
- Notifications can be sent to community members or displayed directly on the dashboard.  

---

**Total: $3,500 – 4 weeks development**

# Benefits to the Zcash Community
- **Transparency:** Enables real-time tracking of grant progress.  
- **Accountability:** Provides a visual progress overview to keep grant recipients aligned with their milestones.  
- **Engagement:** The dashboard’s unified design improves accessibility and ease of monitoring.  
- **Risk Management:** Enables earlier detection of delivery issues and proactive actions to prevent delays.  

# Additional Background
**BuildUnion** is a collective of developers, designers, and strategists focused on Web3 tooling, DAO infrastructure, and decentralized governance. We operate as an integrated unit to deliver high-impact, production-grade applications.  

Personally, I bring extensive multi-chain experience as a **Web3 Architect** and long-time contributor to decentralized governance. I was an early contributor to Dash, helping shape some of the first DAO governance mechanisms, and have since contributed to:  
- Polkadot’s governance infrastructure  
- Solana’s developer tooling  
- Arweave’s storage protocols  
- Arbitrum DAO community initiatives  

My expertise includes front-end and back-end development, data integration, and the design of transparent tracking systems.  

A recent relevant example is my work on **OG Tracker for the Polkadot ecosystem**, a tool to monitor project and governance activity. This cross-chain perspective enables me to design interoperable, user-focused solutions directly applicable to the Zcash ecosystem.  

- **LinkedIn:** [linkedin.com/in/emmanueleclipsewebsite/](http://linkedin.com/in/emmanueleclipsewebsite/)  

---

# Visual Reference
Sample image: [https://ibb.co/PsjxrbNx](https://ibb.co/PsjxrbNx)  
*The dashboard for the Zcash community will be customized with branding and a color scheme to match.*  

---

**Best regards,**  
*Emmanuel / BuildUnion*

proposal.title: Proposal for a new DAO member: James Katz
proposal.description:
James is a software developer from Brazil with a background in IT. He has been working with computers and electronics since childhood and started learning to code in the early 2000s using QBASIC 4.5 on a Pentium PC.

He first became involved with Zcash around mid-2022 after receiving an invite to join the Zcash Brasil Discord server. He quickly became interested in the project’s mission of protecting privacy and began learning more about how Zcash works. Over time, he became more active in the community and eventually got closer to the Zcash Brasil team, which at the time was independently operated and supported by Michael, who served as the Zcash ambassador in Brazil.

James mentioned that he was a programmer and began developing some small tools for the community. The first were Discord bots: ZecQuiz, which challenged users with Zcash-related questions, and ZecStats, which fetched price data and presented it cleanly in Discord. These were hobby projects at first, but they were noticed, and Michael generously rewarded him with his first full $ZEC.

Later, he was encouraged by the Zcash Brasil team to apply for a grant through Zcash Community Grants. He proposed a Discord bot that could send and receive ZEC, making it easier to onboard users and distribute shielded funds. Around that time, the ZF Minor Grants program was announced, and he applied. His proposal was accepted after the Zcash Community Advisory Panel (ZCAP) voted in favor of it.

That project became Dizzy, a Discord-based hot wallet for Zcash, which remains one of his most significant contributions. Eventually, James was invited to become a member of the ZCAP, the same panel that had once voted to approve his grant.

After the grant ended, he started looking for ways to keep Dizzy running (since hosting isn’t cheap), and that’s when he officially joined the Zcash Brasil team, who welcomed him with open arms. Since then, his contributions have only grown.

Some highlights include:
Maintaining and improving Dizzy, especially during events like the spam attack and the Nu6 upgrade.
Building and operating ZecFaucet, a public Zcash faucet with strong anti-abuse mechanisms.
Creating ZcashMetro, a graphical mempool visualizer.

Contributing to other Zcash projects, such as helping Zingolabs with their Zingo-PC wallet build, writing early code for a universal wallet parser, publishing a ZecWallet update with Nu6 and ZIP-317 support (which helped some users recover lost funds), and building tools for ZecHub to track on-chain activity like Sapling and Orchard usage over time.

Today, James continues to study Zcash in depth and work on new ideas to strengthen the ecosystem.

# Background:

The ZecHub DAO currently approved 'Robmar` and `Blakiat` with proposals A-00098 and A-00099 respectively.

# Why:

In the interest of further decentralization and resilience I propose to to add Robmar and Blakiat to the DAO officially. 

# Proposal:

I propose to add the following JUNO addresses:

Robmarn - juno1lnedamfghyfv57kwncraaltqrw73xudy43x79h

Blakiat - juno1vwm749frt2qweafed2egzyvkd9knwf7zmm5zvj

with each address having voting power 1, which is equal to 1/n where n is the number of members in the DAO.


# Action:

A vote of "Yes" supports adding Robmarn and Blakiat as new members, and if passes will execute an action adding them to the DAO.

proposal.title: Zcash Ghana Community (October 2025 – December 2025)
proposal.description:
Project Description:
The Zcash Ghana driving focus is to continue onboarding Ghanaians crypto users and businesses to the Zcash blockchain through its mission of blockchain education and financial privacy. This project started officially on June 30th 2025 with the creation of its X (twitter) handle @ZcashGH, where contents promoting Zcash and financial privacy were posted. Also we have been able to host X-Space events and physical meetup where we educated over 25 persons about Zcash and onboard them to Zcash through the creation of their Zcash wallets. Currently we have over 20 Ghanaians signed up as Zcash Ghana Volunteers.

The Goal is to continue building an active Zcash Ghana community across various cities in Ghana. Educate Ghanains about Zcash’s privacy features and real-world applications. Increase the accessibility of Zcash-related content through localization and translation. Enhance user engagement through interactive activities, contests, and webinars. Encourage discussions on blockchain privacy and financial security within Ghana and ensuring wider adoption and understanding of privacy-focused blockchain technology in Ghana and Africa at large. Foster collaborations between Zcash and regional blockchain developers to create new privacy-focused solutions.

The reason for this grant:
We are asking for this grant to help us continue building the Zcash Ghana community through our various blockchain education and financial privacy activities which include content creations, educational gaming, meetups and workshops, as well as collaborate with other web3 communities, all these leading towards more adoption of Zcash protocol in Ghana. With this grant we will host monthly Zcash Ghana physical meetup, monthly X-Space event and monthly game challenge together with educational content posts.

Past work:
https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcash-ghana-meetup-1-onboarding-to-zcash/51917

https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/join-the-zcash-ghana-x-space-event-02-why-zcash-exploring-shielded-payments-business-potential/51648

https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/join-the-maiden-zcash-ghana-x-space-event-this-sunday/51597

Requested amount for 3 months: 4500 USD (1500 USD per month)

Conclusion: 
Zcash Ghana will serve as a vital hub for Ghanaians to learn, engage, and participate in the Zcash ecosystem. By combining content creation, community management, and strategic outreach, towards executing our mission of blockchain education and financial privacy for the activation of an active community dedicated to Zcash and its mission. 

Thank you.

proposal.title: Zcash Korea Ambassador Proposal (September to December)
proposal.description:
Background

Since February 2025, I have been serving as the Korean Global Ambassador for Zcash.

Over the past six months, I have focused on building visibility, accessibility, and community engagement for Zcash among Korean users. Thanks to the support of ZecHub DAO, I was able to grow the Korean community and create the foundation for further expansion.

Zcash Korea X (Twitter): Grew from 12 followers (Feb 13, 2025) to 310 followers (Sep 13, 2025). Posts now average 15–20 likes per post.

Community Channels: Established and currently managing KakaoTalk and Telegram communities.

Educational Content: Published blog posts and guides in Korean (e.g., Brave Wallet, Zashi usage, Organization related to Zcash ).

Community Events: Hosted campaigns to encourage shielded address usage among Korean users.


Problem Statement

Korean users remain underrepresented in the global Zcash community, despite Korea being one of the most active markets for blockchain adoption in Asia. Without consistent Korean-language content, education, and community engagement, Zcash risks losing visibility in this important region.


Objectives

My key goals are:

Establish the largest Zcash community in Asia (by growing the Korean base).

Recruit at least 2 Korean ZecHub DAO members by the end of 2025.

Build sustainable engagement channels for Korean users.


Proposed Activities

Content & Translation: Provide timely Korean translations of Zcash updates, reports, and announcements.

Community Engagement: Grow activity on X, KakaoTalk, and Telegram through daily/weekly content and discussions.

Events: Host at least one community event per month (giveaways, shielded address campaigns, AMAs, etc.).

Reporting: Publish a monthly Zcash Korea report to share updates with the DAO.

Brand Presence: Maintain the X verification badge to ensure trust and credibility.


Deliverables

Monthly Zcash updates (Korean translations)

4 community events (1 per month)

4 monthly Zcash Korea reports

Recruitment of at least 2 Korean ZecHub DAO members

Steady growth of X followers and community activity


Budget

Monthly Compensation: $500

Total (4 months): $2,000


Closing

If this proposal is approved, I will continue my work not for personal financial gain, but with the mission of helping Zcash establish a strong and sustainable presence in Korea. With the DAO’s support, I believe we can build the largest and most vibrant Zcash community in Asia.

Thank you for your continued support.

proposal.title: Zcash present at key events in Spain
proposal.description:
## Greetings, Zcashers!
 
Without a doubt, Zcash has had a tremendous year. Beyond the price of ZEC (which is important, but not the most important thing), over the last 11 months we have had a halving, major wallet updates, updates to Zebra, a powerful new Zcon, and a host of partnerships with other projects, such as Brave, Nym, Namada, Flexa, Near, Keystone, etc.

 
And all this because, thanks to internal leadership from the ECC and the ZF, the narrative about what momentum, marketing, and the Zcash brand mean has changed. This is how, in recent months, we have seen Zcash's presence at major events in Asia, Europe, and the United States, thanks to the participation of Josh (ECC), Zooko, and members of the ZCG, among others.

 
The communities are also making a great effort: events in Nigeria, Ghana, Turkey, Brazil, and the Spanish-speaking Zcash community promoting Zcash's presence in Mexico and Spain, as well as Venezuela, thanks to the Zcash Clubs.

 
And that is bearing fruit.

 
This year, Aura Brito and I (team Zcast) have once again been invited to participate in this major event, the European Blockchain Convention 2025, in addition to BNEW. The cost of tickets to these events is over €1,500, and they have been given to us for free.

 
Last year we were invited to four events in three cities: the European Blockchain Convention and BNEW in Barcelona, Madrid Tech Show in Madrid, and HCPP in Prague.

 
**This year we are going for more!**

 
Aura and I now live in Barcelona, and with the networking we have been building over the last few months, the stage is set for us to attend more events on behalf of Zcash, do more networking, create more multimedia content, talk to more people about Zcash, and strategically continue to spread the message of privacy.

 
**For this fall-winter season, we have put together a schedule of key events in Spain to increase our positioning and visibility. These events are:**


Watch Out Bitcoin: https://wobitcoin.org/

Merge Madrid: https://www.mmerge.io/es

Madrid Tech Show: https://www.techshowmadrid.es/

**To cover tickets, transportation and accommodation costs in Madrid, the total amount is €4,000 (approximately $4,700 USD).**

 
## Why are these events important?
 
**BNEW,** is the largest technology and entrepreneurship event in Barcelona. It is a media event and we already have tickets, because we were invited.


**EBC (European Blockchain Convention),** although not a privacy-focused event, is one of the most important conferences on blockchain in Europe. It brings together the main blockchain projects and their communities. Even Monero enthusiasts attend. We have already been invited and have tickets.



**Madrid Tech Show,** like last year, we have been invited and already have tickets. Although it is not a blockchain technology event, it is an e-commerce event for people and startups interested in new forms of payment. We believe it is important to raise awareness of Zcash as a payment alternative.



**Watchout Bitcoin,** an event about Bitcoin, where Zcash should have a presence. More and more bitcoiners are looking for alternatives for their privacy. In my opinion, Zcash should always have a presence at every Bitcoin event, because Zcash is a private Bitcoin.



**Merge Madrid,** a 100% crypto and web3 event. A space where Zcash must make itself visible in Spain and throughout Europe. Speakers and communities from the main crypto projects in the ecosystem gather here.


 
 
**As I mentioned above, the idea of attending these events is to establish a presence as the Zcash brand, to make ourselves visible, and to establish new contacts and approaches with projects, professionals, or organizations that may be interested in Zcash.**


 
Zcash continues on its path toward an unstoppable transformation from within, with its governance, improving its protocol, and offering the best wallets and technology in the blockchain ecosystem. And our commitment is to make that visible to as many people as possible.

 
 
## Who we are.

 
**Roosevelt Gordones,** moderator of Zcash en Español, co-host of Zcast, co-host of Club Zcash Barcelona, member of the core team of Zcash en Español, as well as the core team of the Zk Av Club.

 
**Aura Brito,** Co-host of Zcast, co-host of Club Zcash Barcelona, member of the core team of Zcash en Español, part of the marketing team at Zingo Labs en Español, and also a member of the Zk Av Club.


## Deliverables
 
Covering events involves a lot of work: making videos, conducting interviews, contacting people, and creating content for social media, which not only leaves a record of our presence but also showcases what we have achieved.

 
**The deliverables for the events are described below:**

 
**EBC (European Blockchain Convention) Oct. 16-17**

- 2 live summaries of the day (one for each day of the event) (YouTube)
- 2 videos interviewing and talking with some of the event attendees (YouTube)
- Live tweets during the conferences and event activities (X)

 
**Watch Out Bitcoin Oct. 3, 4, and 5**
- 3 live summaries of the day (YouTube)
- 3 videos interviewing and talking with some of the event attendees
- Live tweets during the conferences and event activities (X)

 
**Merge Madrid Oct. 7, 8, and 9**
- 3 live videos summarizing the day (YouTube)
- 3 videos interviewing and chatting with some of the event attendees
- Live tweets during the conferences and event activities (X)

 
**Madrid Tech Show Oct. 29-30**
- 2 live videos summarizing the day (one for each day of the event) (YouTube)
- 2 videos interviewing and chatting with some of the event attendees (YouTube)
- Live tweets during the conferences and event activities (X)

 
**Total event coverage content:**
- 10 live streams (YouTube)
- 10 videos interviewing and chatting (YouTube)
- +100 live tweets (X)
 
As a member of the Zk Av Club, to which we also belong, this work is a kind of mobile recording station, because although we will not have our own stand or kiosk at the events, we will be walking around with cameras and microphones in hand, approaching people, asking for their impressions and, obviously, telling them about what we do at Zcash globally and in Spain with the Zcash Barcelona Club.

 
The purpose of all this is for Zcash to have an increasing presence in Spain's vibrant and active technology and blockchain community, and for people to start getting used to seeing Zcash and hearing the privacy narrative that we always promote.


## In summary: Do you approve of providing funds to cover these events?

**Vote YES if you agree.**

**Vote NO if you disagree.**

We count on your support to cover this route of events and bring Zcash to more people.
 
### Let's keep promoting freedom and privacy!

proposal.title: Zcash Ukraine Regional Community Initiative
proposal.description:
# Zcash Ukraine Regional Community Initiative  
**Period:** December 2025 – May 2026  
**Submitted by:** Beyond  

---

## Introduction  
Dear Zcash Community,  

My name is Beyond, and I coordinate the Zcash Ukraine Regional Community Initiative. Since June 2025, we have been actively building a Ukrainian-speaking community focused on education, awareness, and practical adoption of private digital payments using Zcash.  

Thanks to community support and prior grants, we have achieved high activity levels with around **100 posts per month** across multiple platforms, successful offline events, and an engaged regional ambassador who has already contributed significantly to event organization. We now seek continued funding to further develop the initiative from December 2025 through May 2026.  

## Why Ukraine?  
Ukraine remains in a complex situation of war, economic instability, and increasing financial surveillance. At the same time, more people are adopting cryptocurrencies as a safeguard for their assets and freedom.  

Zcash, as a protocol with strong privacy protections, is uniquely positioned to empower freelancers, activists, entrepreneurs, and everyday citizens by providing secure tools for financial autonomy that are resistant to censorship and surveillance.  

## Project Goals (December 2025 – May 2026)  
- Continue growing and scaling the Ukrainian-language Zcash community.  
- Create and distribute high-quality localized educational content in Ukrainian.  
- Onboard new users with a focus on practical usage of ZEC wallets.  
- Host two offline meetups to deepen community engagement and facilitate onboarding.  
- Support and expand the network of regional ambassadors to sustain growth.  

## Work Plan  
### Content and Communication (Monthly):  
- Manage active presence on Telegram, Twitter/X, Instagram, LinkedIn.  
- Produce approximately **100 posts monthly**, including educational materials, news, threads, infographics, and video explainers.   

### Offline Activities:  
- Organize **two offline meetups** during the proposal period in Dnipro or other cities.  
- Event formats include workshops, hands-on sessions, and practical Zcash wallet onboarding.  

### Ambassador Support:  
- Maintain engagement of at least one regional ambassador who has already supported past events, with potential to onboard one or two more.  
- Provide ambassadors with resources to assist in event planning, content creation, and community outreach.  

## Expected Outcomes  
- Creation of over **600 localized, high-quality educational content pieces** over 6 months.  
- Delivery of two successful in-person community meetups involving practical onboarding.  
- Sustained Telegram community growth with active participation and new user acquisition.  
- Development of a network of ambassadors to continue Zcash advocacy beyond the grant period.  
- Enhanced visibility and reputation of Zcash in Ukraine as a leading privacy payment solution.  

## Budget  
For executing these activities, we request funding of **14 ZEC per month over 6 months, totaling 84 ZEC**.  

This budget covers:  
- Production and moderation of a significant volume of localized content.  
- Organization and facilitation of two offline meetups with all necessary logistics.  
- Compensation and support for regional ambassadors helping to maintain and grow the community.  

## Progress to Date  
Our initiative has built strong momentum, highlighted in our regular monthly reports:  
- [August 2025 Report](https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcash-ukraine-monthly-report-august-1-31-2025/52039)  
- [September 2025 Report](https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcash-ukraine-monthly-report-september-1-30-2025/52281)  

We have successfully hosted offline events with practical user onboarding, produced an extensive volume of localized educational content, and expanded our social media presence to reach a growing audience of IT professionals, freelancers, activists, and crypto users.  

## About Me  
I am Beyond, a digital security and privacy educator, Web3 community organizer (Nym, Web3Privacy Now), and the coordinator of Zcash Ukraine since June 2025.  
Twitter/X: [@Beyond_Karto](https://x.com/Beyond_Karto)  

With your support, we will continue to strengthen Zcash’s presence in Ukraine, onboarding hundreds of new users and establishing Zcash as a practical privacy tool in one of the world’s most challenging environments for financial freedom.  

Thank you for considering our application.

proposal.title: Delegate Community builders fund to ZecHub DAO Validator
proposal.description:
## Background

Squirrel and Dismad earned the DAO a total of 104000 NAM from the Namada Community Builders Program in 2024.
Squirrel already transfered their share [45657 NAM] into the DaoDao multisg. Dismad currently holds the
remaining 58433 NAM. I would like to ask the DAO to stake this portion in the ZecHub DAO Validator to earn
NAM rewards for the DAO.

## Why?

The ZecHub DAO currently earns a commission of 10% of all staking rewards. These rewards will be used to fund the costs
of the server, and any extra NAM that is earned will be kept for the DAO to be used at a later time. This is another
stream of revenue for the DAO. 

The ZecHub DAO Validator currently has active voting power: 3,713,769.524115 NAM

See:

```markdown
https://explorer75.org/namada/validators/tnam1q9rzmgclz9lgys34cmfe3wfry25nhlasayxzuk3c
```


## Proposal

* Stake 58433 NAM from the Community Builders fund with the ZecHub DAO Validator.
* The ZecHub DAO Validator is located at address: tnam1q9rzmgclz9lgys34cmfe3wfry25nhlasayxzuk3c


## Action

With DAO approval, Dismad will stake 58433 NAM from the Community Builders fund with the ZecHub DAO Validator.

proposal.title: Proposal: Zcash x BlockchainUNN Conference 4.0 — Building the Future of Privacy in Africa
proposal.description:
# **Proposal: Zcash x BlockchainUNN Conference 4.0 — Building the Future of Privacy in Africa**

---

## **Introduction**

My name is **Kenzo**, a passionate blockchain advocate, builder, and community organizer, dedicated to expanding **Zcash’s mission across Nigeria and Africa**. Alongside [**Treyx**](https://x.com/Treyx_Im), one of **Zcash Nigeria’s most outstanding ambassadors and ecosystem leaders**, we are championing this proposal to invite **Zcash** to partner with the **BlockchainUNN Conference 4.0 — Buildathon Hero**, happening on **November 8, 2025**, at **Ekpo Ref, University of Nigeria, Nsukka**.

Together with the **Zcash Nigeria team**, we have been working to introduce **privacy-preserving technologies**, **educate young developers**, and **build tools** that embody **Zcash’s vision of financial freedom and privacy for all**. This event offers an unprecedented opportunity to take that mission to **thousands of new minds — developers, students, entrepreneurs, and innovators from across Africa**.

---
Since its inception, **BlockchainUNN** has built a reputation as a transformative force in Nigeria’s blockchain education movement. The past three editions witnessed groundbreaking innovation — from decentralized apps tackling local remittance issues to youth-led projects that won regional hackathon prizes. Alumni of the conference have gone on to secure internships, grants, and startup funding across the African Web3 ecosystem.

The 2024 edition, *Code the Future*, hosted major industry players, and drew over **5000+ online viewers** via livestream. The event’s impact continues to ripple across campuses, inspiring student-led blockchain clubs and open-source contributions.

For **2025**, the conference returns stronger, merging technical education with innovation and creativity. The **Buildathon Hero** edition will emphasize cross-chain interoperability, privacy in decentralized finance, and responsible blockchain adoption in Africa. It will serve as a launchpad for collaboration between global blockchain networks and local African developers.

BlockchainUNN’s unique format — combining hackathons, workshops, keynote sessions, and exhibitions — ensures **practical engagement** and **real project development**, not just theoretical discussions. This year, the organizing team expects record participation from **over 30 universities across Nigeria and neighboring countries**.

---

## **Why Zcash Should Be Involved**

**Zcash** is the **largest privacy coin** in the cryptocurrency world — and a **symbol of what it means to protect digital freedom**.  
An event of this scale offers a **moment that Zcash cannot afford to miss**.

Projects like **Arbitrum**, **Sui Network**, and **Lisk** have already participated in similar community-led hackathons, leveraging such platforms to grow developer interest and ecosystem awareness. **Now is the perfect time for Zcash** to take its rightful place in **Africa’s blockchain evolution**.

### **Benefits of Zcash’s Participation**

- 🌍 **Visibility** before thousands of builders and students passionate about blockchain technology.  
- 🏕️ **Dedicated booth** where Zcash can host demos, distribute swag, and engage developers.  
- 📢 **Media exposure** across livestreams, banners, press features, and post-event documentaries.  
- 💡 **Direct community interaction** to inspire new African projects built on Zcash’s privacy technology.  
- 🤝 **Collaboration opportunities** with developers interested in DeFi, payments, and cross-chain tools.

This partnership would mark a **turning point for Zcash in Africa**, strengthening its ecosystem and **introducing shielded transactions** to the region’s fast-growing builder base.

---

## **Proposed Zcash Partnership Support**

We’re requesting **$3,000 in support from Zcash** to power our joint participation.  
The funds will be allocated as follows:

| **Item** |  | **Amount (USD)** |
|-----------|------------------|------------------|
| Booth setup, banners, and branded Zcash materials (T-shirts, stickers, flyers) | — | **$1,600** |
| Developer workshop logistics (technical equipment, internet, hackathon support) | — | **$700** |
| Travel, lodging, and coordination for Zcash Nigeria representatives | — | **$600** |
| Post-event video documentation and follow-up community workshop | — | **$100** |

---

## **Zcash Builders Workshop**

During the hackathon, our team will host a **Zcash Builders Workshop**, guiding participants through **hands-on development** with **Zcash’s privacy technology**, **shielded transactions**, and **integrations with modern blockchain frameworks**.

This session will **empower new African builders** to create **tools, dApps, and financial models** that embody **Zcash’s principles of security and privacy**.

---

## **Community Engagement & Experience**

Beyond learning, we’ll make the **Zcash experience engaging and fun** — with:

- 🧩 **Interactive demos**  
- ❓ **Live Q&A sessions**  
- 🎁 **Giveaways and creative challenges**  

All designed to make **privacy technology exciting and accessible**.

The **Zcash booth** will serve as a **vibrant hub** where students and developers can **experience Zcash firsthand**, **explore opportunities in the ecosystem**, and **connect with mentors**.

---

## **Impact**

Zcash’s presence will not only **amplify its visibility** but also **ignite a long-term wave of adoption in Nigeria** — a country known for its **fast-growing blockchain talent pool** and **entrepreneurial energy**.

By joining forces at **BlockchainUNN**, **Zcash** positions itself as a **leader in Africa’s next phase of blockchain innovation**.

---

[Images From past event](https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/partnership-invitation-blockchainunn-conference-4-0-buildathon-hero/52527)
---

## **Conclusion**

Together, we can **inspire the next generation of privacy-first builders** and prove that **privacy is not just a feature — it’s freedom**.

> **Let’s make history at BlockchainUNN 4.0.**  
> **Zcash x BlockchainUNN: Building Africa’s Private Future.**

proposal.title: Zcash Global Ambassador
proposal.description:
Background:

I’m Elzz, a content strategist and researcher with over five years of experience in Web3, focused on simplifying complex blockchain concepts through relatable content and community engagement.

I first built experience in the Solana ecosystem, where I saw how powerful clear communication can be for driving adoption. I later applied that experience in projects like Ice Open Network, Star Tower Chain, and SonicSVM, helping them grow through strong storytelling and active community building.

In recent months, I’ve been involved in the Zcash ecosystem, joining community calls, engaging on Discord and creating content around Zcash’s mission of privacy and financial freedom. Some of my work has already gained recognition from core community members like Josh Swihart and Zooko, which motivates me to take my contribution to the next level as a Zcash Ambassador.

Why

Zcash is a project with one of the strongest value propositions in crypto: privacy, but the way it’s often communicated can feel closed-off to newcomers. I believe adoption grows when people understand and people understand when the message is clear, simple and relatable.

That’s where I come in. As an ambassador, my motivation is to be a bridge: between technical depth and everyday language, between developers and the broader crypto audience and between Zcash and new regions like Nigeria, where the conversation around privacy is still only beginning.

Goals

Content: Create consistent, beginner-friendly content (threads, articles, visuals) that break down Zcash’s technology, updates and ecosystem activity in accessible ways.

Community Voice: Host regular discussions and spaces focused on engaging both developers and non-technical community members.

Onboarding: Actively welcome and guide newcomers, helping them find their place in the ecosystem. Also use my access to blockchain developers in my region to influence building on Zcash.

Regional Presence: Represent Zcash in Nigeria, where crypto adoption is growing rapidly but privacy narratives are underrepresented.

Deliverables 
1. Reach & Visibility

Achieve at least 10,000 tweet impressions per month from Zcash-related content.

Maintain steady month-over-month growth in engagement (likes, retweets, comments).

2. Engagement & Community Connection

Host 2 Twitter Spaces per month, maintaining at least 20 unique listeners on average.

Get meaningful engagement (comments, questions, retweets) from known figures or active community members in the Zcash ecosystem.

Build an active base of users who consistently reply, quote, or engage with my Zcash content.

3. Education & Awareness

Publish 2 educational threads/articles per month simplifying Zcash topics (privacy, shielded txs, zk proofs, etc.).

Measure audience sentiment (through replies, comments, polls) showing that more users understand and can explain Zcash concepts after my content and Spaces.

Host a micro meet-up monthly, with the aim of onboarding developers and crypto enthusiasts in my locality into Zcash.

4. Ecosystem Impact

Drive at least 5 new users per month to try a Zcash wallet or send their first shielded transaction.

Help increase mentions of Zcash across crypto discussions and communities outside its usual circles in my region.

5. Reporting & Accountability

Provide monthly progress updates (impressions, engagement, event highlights).

Submit a 3-month summary report with key metrics, screenshots and learnings for potential program renewal.

Monthly Budget 
Ambassador Stipend - $500
Freelance Content Support (Video editing & Graphics)- $200
Twitter Premium Pro - $30
Community Rewards & Activation - $100
Micro-Meetup Fund - $170
Total -$1,000/ $3000 (3 months)

Conclusion
I’m already doing the work, showing up, creating content and connecting with the Zcash community. As an ambassador, I will take that to the next level with consistency, visibility and dedication to the Zcash mission.


Contact Me
Twitter/X: @CQ_Elzz
Telegram: @CQ_Elzz
Discord: #the_elzz
Email: cq.elzzz@gmail.com

proposal.title: Zcash Birthday x Orphanage Empowerment Initiative: Protect Their Future: Zcash Privacy Awareness for Orphans
proposal.description:
BACKGROUND OVERVIEW

As Zcash celebrates its 9th anniversary, this milestone presents an opportunity to turn celebration into purpose by empowering those who are most vulnerable when it comes to privacy and personal protection. Across many communities, orphans and vulnerable children are often exposed to risks such as identity misuse, online exploitation, and lack of financial control. Their personal information is frequently managed by institutions or others, leaving them unaware of how data privacy and digital safety affect their lives.
Zcash stands for financial privacy, freedom, and dignity values that extend far beyond cryptocurrency. This project, “Protect Their Future: Zcash Privacy Awareness for Orphans,” will bring Zcash’s mission directly into an orphanage setting through an interactive, one-day educational and celebratory event. By hosting the event within the orphanage center itself, Zcash will meet participants in their familiar environment, reducing logistical barriers and creating a warm, inclusive atmosphere. The day will combine learning, empowerment, and celebration, showing that Zcash doesn’t just talk about privacy, it lives it.

Objectives:
1. Teach orphans and caregivers the importance of digital and financial privacy.
2. Introduce Zcash as a global leader in privacy-focused technology that protects individuals.
3. Equip participants with practical digital safety habits for daily life.
4. Celebrate Zcash’s 9th anniversary with a meaningful community outreach event.
5. Strengthen Zcash’s image as a champion of human dignity and data protection.

Target Audience:
1. 25–30 orphans (ages 13–21) residing in the orphanage.
2. 10 caregivers or administrators from the center.
3. 5–10 community volunteers from the Zcash and local digital education community.

Event Overview:

Event Title: Protect Their Future: Zcash Privacy Awareness for Orphans

Venue: Main Hall, [Name of Orphanage Center]

Date: To coincide with Zcash’s 9th Anniversary Week

Duration: One Full Day (9:00 AM – 4:00 PM)

Format: In-person educational workshop, interactive activities, and Zcash birthday celebration.

Event Schedule (One Day at the Orphanage Center)
1. 9:00 – 9:30 AM - Welcome & Opening Session:
Introduction to Zcash, greetings from the orphanage director, and an overview of the day’s theme: “Privacy Protects Dignity.”
2. 9:30 – 10:15 AM - Session 1: Understanding Privacy:
Fun, interactive discussion on what privacy means, why it matters, and real-life examples (photos, passwords, and personal information).
3. 10:15 – 10:45 AM - Activity 1: “Who Am I Online?”
Small group activity exploring how we share personal data on the internet and how to protect it.
4. 10:45 – 11:15 AM - Tea Break & Networking:
Light refreshments and informal chats. Volunteers mingle with children and caregivers.
5. 11:15 AM – 12:15 PM - Session 2: Financial Privacy & Zcash:
Simplified introduction to money in the digital world — how Zcash uses encryption to protect users’ financial information. Demonstration using easy-to-understand visuals.
6. 12:15 – 1:00 PM - Activity 2: “My Privacy Promise” Wall:
Each child writes one personal privacy rule and posts it on the Zcash Privacy Wall. Caregivers add their pledges too.
7. 1:00 – 2:00 PM - Lunch Break
Shared meal in the orphanage dining area.
8. 2:00 – 3:00 PM - Session 3: Creative Expression – What Privacy Means to Me:
Drawing or short writing competition. Children express how they understand privacy. Winners receive small Zcash-branded gifts.
9. 3:00 – 3:45 PM - Zcash 9th Birthday Celebration
Cake cutting ceremony, group singing of “Happy Birthday Zcash,” and appreciation from orphanage management.
10. 3:45 – 4:00 PM - Closing Remarks & Group Photos
Summary of lessons learned, thank-yous, and photos for Zcash community social posts.

Expected Outcomes:
1. 35–40 total participants gain real understanding of online and financial privacy.
2. Creation of a Zcash Privacy Wall inside the orphanage to remind them daily of what they learned.
3. Increased awareness among caregivers about data protection and responsible technology use.
4. Positive media visibility for Zcash’s 9th birthday as a force for social good.
5. Documentation (photos and videos) that can be shared with Zcash supporters and community channels.

Budget Breakdown (Under $2,000)
Estimated Cost (USD)

Setup & Logistics - Canopy/tent (if outdoor), chairs, decorations, table covers =$350

Refreshments & Lunch - Meals, snacks, and drinks for children and guests =$200

Educational Materials - Flyers, notebooks, pens, posters, banners =$300

Zcash Privacy Kits - Stickers, t-shirts, gift bags for participants =$400

Media & Documentation - Photographer, short video, social content =$200

Event Branding - Cake, balloons, birthday signage =$150

Transportation & Coordination - For volunteers, supplies delivery =$200

Contingency - Miscellaneous $200

Total Estimated Cost = $2,000

Evaluation and Reporting:
1. Attendance list and feedback forms completed by participants and caregivers.
2. Photo and video documentation of all activities.
3. Impact report summarizing what participants learned and how they responded.
4. Short social media video tagged with #Zcash9 #PrivacyForAll #ZcashForGood to showcase the event globally.

Impact Statement:
1. By holding the event directly within the orphanage center, Zcash meets the community where they are making privacy tangible, relatable, and personal.
2. This project transforms Zcash’s 9th anniversary into a celebration of compassion and empowerment.
3. For these children, privacy means safety. For their caregivers, privacy means trust. For Zcash, it’s a chance to show that financial privacy and human dignity are inseparable.
This initiative proves that privacy is not just about code, it’s about care.

Conclusion:

Zcash’s 9th birthday is more than a celebration; it’s a statement of purpose. Through “Protect Their Future: Zcash Privacy Awareness for Orphans,” the Zcash community will demonstrate that privacy can be a tool for empowerment and protection especially for those whose voices are often unheard.
By investing under $2,000, Zcash can leave a lasting mark inside the orphanage on a day that teaches, celebrates, and uplifts, all under the banner of Privacy for All.

For more detailed analysis and more clarity: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KUBBVnWzNUHPLUpqjxrWm1ioLUHcrml2UFmMPAiCSRk/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.swyotvk2h3pz

proposal.title: Continue Development of ZEC Bounties
proposal.description:
## Overview

During the recent hackathon, I, Tron, built ZEC Bounties (1st place), a working, semi-complete platform that allows the community to post, manage, and claim bounties whilst earning ZEC. The MVP demonstrated that the concept is feasible and can serve as a practical tool for rewarding community contributions.

This proposal aims to evolve ZEC Bounties from a hackathon project into a production-ready product hosted under “bounties.zechub.wiki” (or any other domain), complete with real-time updates, improved security, and a polished user experience.

## Goals

* Deliver a stable, secure, and feature-complete ZEC Bounties platform.

* Integrate real-time communication so bounty updates appear instantly (no page refreshes).

* Add user notification options — via Gmail and potential integration with ZECpublish or direct shielded memos.

* Deploy the project under “bounties.zechub.wiki” (or any other domain) with a maintainable backend and production-grade database.

* Establish a long-term foundation for updates and maintenance within the DAO.

## Technical Stack

* Frontend: Next.js (App Router, TypeScript, shadcn, TailwindCSS)

* Backend: Express.js with WebSocket integration

* Database: PostgreSQL (production instance)

* Hosting: Vercel (frontend) + Render/Railway (backend + database)

* Notifications: Gmail & ZECpublish / shielded memo messages (potentially)

## Estimated Timeline (8 Weeks Total)

| Week  | Milestone |  Deliverables |
| :-------------: |:-------------|:-------------|
| 1      | Codebase Refactor | Clean architecture, improved folder structure, and clearer logic. |
| 2-4      | WebSocket Integration | Real-time bounty posting, updates, and claim notifications. |
| 5      | Security & Validation | Harden backend routes, sanitize inputs, secure the database. |
| 6      | Notification System      | Implement Gmail + ZECpublish / shielded memo messages for bounty creation and fulfillment (potentially). |
| 7      | UI/UX Enhancements      | Visual consistency, responsive design, and interaction polish. |
| 8      | Hosting & Deployment      | Production deployment to “bounties.zechub.wiki”, database migration, and testing. |


## Hosting & Infrastructure

The platform will initially use free-tier hosting services to minimize cost while maintaining reliability:

* Frontend: Vercel (Hobby Plan)

* Backend: Render or Railway (Free Tier)

* Database: Neon.tech or Supabase (Free Tier)

* Domain: Existing zechub.wiki subdomain — bounties.zechub.wiki

These services are sufficient for the current scale.

If traffic increases or higher uptime becomes necessary, the hosting can later be upgraded to paid plans.

## Budget & Compensation

* Development rate: $50 /hour
* Community discount: $23 /hour (54% reduction)

* Hours per week: 40
* Duration: 8 weeks (320 hours total)

Total cost:
($23 × 320) / 223 ≈ 33 ZEC (@ $223/ZEC) (If it is lower than $223/ZEC, then it will be adjusted to the current value)

This discounted rate reflects my commitment to the Zcash ecosystem — I’m approaching this as a community contributor rather than an external contractor.

The total covers:

* Full-stack refactor and optimization

* Real-time update system (WebSockets)

* Gmail + ZECpublish / shielded memo messages(potentially)

* Backend security review

* UI/UX touch-up and deployment setup

## Conclusion

ZEC Bounties has already proven itself as a working MVP.
This proposal focuses on turning it into a reliable, real-world product that empowers the community to fund and reward meaningful work within the Zcash ecosystem.

By starting lean with free-tier hosting and community-minded pricing, we can deliver strong value immediately — and scale sustainably as adoption increases.
