proposal.title: Proposal for a new DAO member: Zolder
proposal.description:
Hello ZecHub DAO,

Today, I’d like to introduce a new Korean member to our DAO.
He’s an active advocate for Zcash on X (formerly Twitter) and has been a dedicated Zcash investor since 2017. (X address: https://x.com/Mindmovesme ; Followers: 1,095)

Below is an introduction from Zolder.
________________________________________

I’ve been working as a process engineer in the semiconductor industry for over 10 years, focusing on data analysis and precision process control to achieve reliability and accuracy in manufacturing.

My journey in crypto began in 2016. In 2018, I discovered that the chips I helped develop were actually being used in cryptocurrency mining machines delivered to customers — a moment that deepened my interest in blockchain technology. Since then, I’ve been actively involved in various Web3 projects such as NFT trading, The Sandbox, and Decentraland, and I’m currently engaging with the Mocaverse community by Animoca Brands, building connections with the global blockchain ecosystem.

As time goes on, security and privacy are becoming even more critical in our real-world society. I deeply resonate with Zcash’s philosophy of true individual freedom and transparency, and I’ve naturally become captivated by this ecosystem.

I proudly call myself a “Zcash-shouting strong HODLer” — my X profile is dedicated to sharing insights and updates about Zcash. My ENS name, “Zolder” (Zcash + Holder), reflects my belief in Zcash as a trusted privacy network for storing value, and I’ve been consistently working to spread awareness and information about it.

Lately, I’ve been focusing on introducing practical features that users will increasingly need as the Zcash ecosystem grows — such as the Zashi wallet, Crosspay, and Swap functions. My goal is to communicate these topics in a simple and intuitive way so that the Korean Zcash community can continue to grow in a solid and constructive direction.

As an engineer with both technical and data-driven expertise — and a balanced perspective between the real and blockchain worlds — I hope to help make Zcash’s philosophy clear and meaningful to users worldwide, and to build an ecosystem where it’s truly used in practice.

Zheers 🥂

proposal.title: ZcashAraba (November to January)
proposal.description:
Hello!


Project Description The Arabic Zcash Community Initiative is a dedicated effort to expand Zcash adoption, education, and development within the MENA (Middle East & North Africa) region. This initiative aims to bridge the gap between Zcash and Arabic-speaking users by providing localized educational resources, interactive learning tools, and direct developer support.

Project Goals Continue building an active Zcash community in the MENA region. Educate Arabic speakers about Zcash’s privacy features and real-world applications. Increase the accessibility of Zcash-related content through localization and translation. Enhance user engagement through interactive activities, contests, and webinars. Encourage discussions on blockchain privacy and financial security within the region. To establish and grow an Arabic-speaking community for Zcash, ensuring wider adoption and understanding of privacy-focused blockchain technology in the MENA region. Foster collaborations between Zcash and regional blockchain developers to create new privacy-focused solutions.

Our key achievements so far include:
- Growing our community to 500 X followers and 200 Telegram members
- Achieving 1,000+ views on most Twitter posts.
- Consistently generating 200–400+ views per video/article.
- Ranking many of our articles and videos on the first page of Google search results.
- Developing and launching a dedicated Arabic Zcash website.
- Publishing numerous Arabic articles, videos, and educational content, as well as hosting several community events.
- Establishing two local partnerships and engaging in discussions with global projects such as Axelar, Zetachain, and others about collaborations involving Zcash.


Why MENA is Important for Zcash?

Economic Diversification and Innovation: Countries like the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Saudi Arabia are actively diversifying their economies beyond traditional sectors. The UAE, for instance, has implemented innovation-friendly regulatory frameworks that promote cryptocurrency adoption while ensuring consumer protection. This approach has attracted numerous crypto enthusiasts and entrepreneurs to the region.

Youthful Demographics: Saudi Arabia, with approximately 63% of its population under the age of 30, boasts a young and tech-savvy demographic. This group is particularly open to experimenting with new financial technologies, including cryptocurrencies, making it a promising market for Zcash.

Regulatory Support: The UAE continues to experience rapid growth in the crypto space, driven by a combination of regulatory innovation, institutional interest, and expanding market activity. Between July 2023 and June 2024, the UAE received over $30 billion in crypto, ranking the country among the top 40 globally in this regard and making it MENA’s third-largest crypto economy. The MENA region’s rapid adoption of cryptocurrencies, supported by favorable economic conditions and regulatory frameworks, underscores its importance for Zcash’s growth and outreach efforts.

Scope of Work:

Collaborating with other local and regional communities to amplify our efforts and share resources and doing cross-events. Engaging with Arab exchanges to explore the listing of ZEC, which would help increase liquidity, accessibility, and demand across the region. Creating a dedicated website for ZcashArabia to serve as a hub for translated announcements, post original educational articles, and guides focused on Zcash and privacy. Over time, this platform will evolve to offer comprehensive Arabic-language courses for both users and developers, ensuring deeper technical understanding and adoption. Community Management Actively manage and moderate Zcash Arabia's X and Telegram channels. Engage with the community by answering questions, addressing concerns, and fostering discussions around Zcash. Maintain a welcoming and informative environment to attract and retain members. Content Creation & Localization Translation & Dissemination: Translate the latest Zcash news, announcements, and research papers and share them on X and Telegram.

Monthly Content Deliverables
2 articles covering Zcash technology, privacy features, and ecosystem developments)
2 videos explaining Zcash use cases, updates, or tutorials on using Zcash securely. 
2 Twitter threads summarizing key topics, technical insights, or recent updates. 
3 infographics to simplify complex topics and enhance user understanding.
Community Engagement Activities 1 Monthly Contest: Run engaging competitions such as webinars, AMA, quizzes, or user-generated content challenges to boost participation.

Expected Impact: Establish a strong Arabic-speaking Zcash community. Increase awareness and adoption of Zcash within the MENA region. Increase number of new created wallets Provide educational resources tailored to Arabic speakers. Foster long-term engagement through interactive content and community-driven initiative

Past work: https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcasharabia-report/50873

Requested amount for 3 months : 2400 USD (800 USD per month)

Conclusion: Zcash Arabia will serve as a vital hub for Arabic speakers to learn, engage, and participate in the Zcash ecosystem. By combining content creation, community management, and strategic outreach, we aim to grow a thriving, informed, and active community dedicated to Zcash and its mission.

Thank you.

proposal.title: Reviving ZecHub’s Instagram Presence through Story-Driven Content
proposal.description:
Background

I am Joy Jhei, a Web3 content creator, social media manager, strategist and community builder, passionate about using storytelling to make crypto more human and relatable.
I’ve worked with several blockchain and DeFi projects, producing high-value content that drives engagement and meaningful community participation. My background in social media management and video production enables me to create authentic, story-driven content that builds lasting community connections.

Within the Zcash ecosystem, I’ve been an active ZecHub contributor, supporting writing, creative design and collaborative work on community resources, among others. Recently, I produced the video “How Open-Source Communities like Zcash Keep Crypto Human,” which was well received on X and Discord for highlighting Zcash’s human-centered, open-source values.



Project Overview

Building on this foundation, this initiative aims to create a sustained and intentional storytelling strategy through consistent, narrative-driven videos that communicate Zcash’s story in an authentic, accessible and community-centered way.

The goal is to revive and transform ZecHub’s Instagram presence into a vibrant educational space; one that actively informs, inspires and connects with both new and existing members of the Zcash community.

As part of this initiative, I will personally appear in and host the videos, serving as the storyteller and on-camera voice for the project. Each video will feature me discussing different Zcash-related topics, from privacy education and open-source collaboration to community impact stories, making the content more relatable and human-driven.

ZecHub has established itself as a core educational hub, documenting and onboarding contributors worldwide. Yet, while its documentation and bounties thrive, its Instagram presence has gone quiet, revealing a storytelling gap. This project will bridge that gap, bringing ZecHub’s mission to life through consistent, human-focused video content that puts real faces and voices behind the Zcash story.



Execution Plan

1. Content Approach

•	Create short-form videos featuring me as the on-camera presenter, simplifying complex Zcash topics and showcasing community stories through approachable dialogue.

•	Integrate motion graphics, voiceovers and creative visuals to complement the storytelling.

•	Maintain a balanced content mix: educational, inspirational and update-driven.

•	Use storytelling and personal delivery to make Zcash approachable for newcomers and engaging for long-time supporters.

2. Posting & Consistency

•	Publish 2–3 videos per week on Instagram, with highlights shared to X and Discord.

•	Establish monthly content themes (e.g., privacy education, community voices, Zcash use cases) to ensure narrative cohesion.

3. Community Management & Engagement

•	Actively manage ZecHub’s Instagram, responding promptly to DMs, comments and inquiries.

•	Highlight community contributions and encourage participation through polls, Q&As and interactive story prompts.

•	Collaborate with ZecHub contributors and Zcash ambassadors to feature diverse community voices.

4. Progress Tracking & Reporting

•	Monitor engagement metrics (views, shares, saves, comments, follower growth).

•	Collect audience feedback to refine content strategy.

•	Provide monthly progress reports with insights, performance data, and recommendations for continuous improvement.


Deliverables (Over 3 Months):

•	18–24 short-form educational videos (2–3 per week) featuring me as the on-camera host, focused on Zcash topics and community stories.

•	3 monthly reports summarizing progress, analytics, and community engagement metrics.

•	1 revitalized Instagram page with consistent posting, engagement management, and audience growth tracking.

•	3 monthly content themes (e.g., privacy, open-source culture, community voices).

•	Ongoing community interaction through polls, Q&A’s, comments and collaborations with ZecHub contributors.


Timeline

Month 1 – Setup & Launch:
Strategy Development. content planning, brand style setup, initial filming, and first video releases.

Month 2 – Execution & Growth	
Content Rollout	(2–3 videos weekly), active engagement, cross-platform promotion and audience feedback collection.

Month 3 – Refinement & Reporting
Optimization, continued content production, performance analysis, final report and recommendations for next phase.




Proposed Budget

•	Social Media Management & Strategy – $450

Covers the planning, scheduling, and execution of the overall social media strategy to ensure consistency and alignment with campaign goals.

•	Video Production – $250

Includes scripting, recording, and editing of engaging video content to enhance brand communication and audience connection.

•	Creative Design – $100

Covers the design of graphics, carousels and thumbnails to maintain a cohesive and visually appealing brand identity.

•	Reporting & Tools – $50

Includes analytics tracking, scheduling tools and essential subscriptions for performance monitoring and campaign optimization.

Total (Per Month): $850

Project Duration: 3 months

Grand Total: $2,550



Expected Outcomes

•	Revived and consistent ZecHub presence on Instagram.

•	Increased community awareness and participation across social channels.

•	Improved alignment between educational content, contributors and outreach.

•	Human-centered storytelling that strengthens Zcash’s brand and mission.



Conclusion

This project represents more than a social media refresh, it is a renewed commitment to amplifying Zcash’s values through authentic storytelling. By combining creativity, community insight and consistent execution, this initiative will transform ZecHub’s Instagram into a living narrative of what Zcash stands for; privacy, inclusion and human connection.

Over the 3-month period, these videos will not only educate and engage but also inspire trust and belonging within the Zcash ecosystem. Through every story told and every voice amplified, this project will help the community see Zcash not just as technology but as a movement built by people and for people.

proposal.title: Ecosystem Utility Tools for the Zcash Community
proposal.description:
## Executive Summary  
I propose to develop and deploy two high-impact, community-facing tools to accelerate adoption, usability, and integration of Zcash (ZEC). These are:  
1. **Pay-with-Zcash Button Generator** (already prototyped)  
2. **Zcash Donation Widget**

These utilities will enable merchants, creators, websites, and non-profits to integrate ZEC payments easily, accept donations with privacy and simplicity, and provide a seamless user experience.  
By lowering technical barriers and improving payment workflows, we support ecosystem growth, developer engagement, and real-world usage of Zcash.

---

## Project Goals
- Provide a **plug-and-play button generator** for websites to accept Zcash payments.  
- Create an **easy-to-embed donation widget** that supports QR codes, memos, short URLs, and minimal friction for donors and charities.  
- All tools tailored for the Zcash community: privacy-first, user-friendly, and open-source.

---

## Benefits to the Zcash Ecosystem

### 1. Pay-with-Zcash Button Generator
- Enables **merchants and websites** to accept ZEC quickly and easily.  
- Reduces technical barriers to adoption by providing a **plug-and-play embed script**.  
- Supports **privacy-focused payments** with optional memos and labels.  
- Increases **real-world usage** of Zcash in e-commerce and online services.  

### 2. Zcash Donation Widget
- Allows creators, charities, and websites to **accept ZEC donations easily**.  
- Generates **QR codes and short URLs**, improving usability and shareability.  
- Supports **campaign labels and progress tracking**, enhancing donor engagement.  
- Expands the **charitable and creator economy usage** of Zcash.  
- Drives **community adoption** by simplifying donation processes while preserving privacy.

---

## Technical Stack & Approach

**Shared Architecture**
- **Frontend:** React / Next.js + TypeScript for web dashboards and embed views.  
- **Backend:** Node.js / Express (or Next.js API routes) for REST endpoints.  
- **QR Code Generation:** using open-source libraries.  
- **Short URL Service:** lightweight storage (Redis or simple DB) for widget links.  
- **Deployment:** Vercel / Netlify for frontend, Render / AWS for backend.  
- Compatible with both transparent and shielded Zcash addresses.  
- Security and privacy best-practices adhered to.

**Tool-Specific Details**
- **Button Generator:** embed script (vanilla JS) + dashboard for merchants; supports label, amount, address, and theme.  
- **Donation Widget:** embed script, QR code, memo, short link, optional campaign label, and live donation counter.

---

## Deve
## Development Timing & Cost Estimate

We propose a **flat hourly rate of USD 45/hr** for development.  
Conversion into ZEC is approximate and provided for reference (1 ZEC ≈ USD 628).

| Tool | Est. Dev Hours | USD Cost | ≈ ZEC (USD ÷ 628) |
|------|----------------|-----------|--------------------|
| Pay-with-Zcash Button Generator (refinement + deployment) | 24 hrs | \$1,080 | ≈ 1.72 ZEC |
| Donation Widget | 24 hrs | \$1,080 | ≈ 1.72 ZEC |
| **Total Development** | 48 hrs | \$2,160 | ≈ 3.44 ZEC |
| Hosting (12 months @ \$25/mo) | N/A | \$300 | ≈ 0.48 ZEC |
| **Grand Total (Dev + Hosting)** | N/A | **\$2,460** | **≈ 3.92 ZEC** |

*(Note: Hours represent total active development time. Calendar duration includes testing and coordination.)*

---

## Deliverables & Timeline

| Week | Focus | Deliverables |
|------|--------|--------------|
| **Week 1 (Days 1–5)** | Pay-with-Zcash Button Generator | Final refinement, embed script optimization, live deployment, documentation, and demo. |
| **Week 2 (Days 6–10)** | Donation Widget | Embed widget UI, short URL & QR generation, customization options, public release & docs. |

⏱ **Total Calendar Duration:** ~2 weeks (≈ 48 active dev hours)

---

## Deployment, Hosting & Running Cost
- Hosting/deployment will reuse existing infrastructure or require minimal incremental cost.  
- Estimated hosting for 12 months: **\$300**.  
- Tools are designed to scale as community usage increases.

---

## Summary & Funding Request

I request a **grant of \$2,460 USD** (≈ **3.92 ZEC**) to deliver the two utilities over a two-week development timeline.  
These tools will be open, configurable, and ready for adoption across the Zcash community.  
We believe this investment will deliver outsized value by enabling merchant acceptance, donor usage, and developer engagement — driving real growth for Zcash.

---

## Risk & Mitigation
- **ZEC price volatility:** USD estimate is the stable reference; ZEC conversion is approximate.  
- **Adoption risk:** mitigated via easy embedding, clear documentation, and open availability.  
- **Technical complexity:** modest architecture avoids node maintenance, reducing operational risk and cost.

---

### ✅ Summary Snapshot

| Metric | Estimate |
|--------|-----------|
| Total Build Time | 48 hours (≈ 2 weeks) |
| Total Cost | \$2,460 USD (≈ 3.92 ZEC) |
| Hosting | \$25/month × 12 months = \$300 |
| Core Stack | Next.js, Node.js, TypeScript |
| Hosting | Vercel / Render |
| Deliverables | 2 live, open-source web utilities for Zcash adoption |

---

**Thank you for considering this proposal.**  
I am committed to delivering high-quality tools that advance the Zcash ecosystem and make adoption easier for all.

proposal.title: Viewkey-Powered Zcash Payment Verifier
proposal.description:
## Executive Summary
I propose to build a **Zcash Payment Verifier** that leverages **viewkeys** to enable secure verification of shielded ZEC transactions.  

The tool will allow merchants and platforms to confirm incoming payments to shielded addresses **without exposing spending capabilities**, preserving privacy while providing verifiable receipts.

This approach makes verification feasible for shielded transactions — addressing a key limitation in Zcash adoption for merchants and donation platforms.

---

## Project Goals
- Enable verification of incoming shielded Zcash transactions using **viewkeys**.  
- Allow merchants to confirm payment **amounts, memos, and confirmations** without risking funds.  
- Provide a **simple web UI and API** to integrate verification into checkout or donation flows.  
- Preserve Zcash’s **privacy-first design** while supporting merchant usability.

---

## Benefits to the Zcash Ecosystem
- Supports shielded transactions while enabling real-world merchant adoption.  
- Reduces friction for ZEC acceptance in e-commerce and donation platforms.  
- Encourages developers to integrate Zcash payments confidently.  
- Preserves privacy: only transactions tied to a viewkey are visible; all other transactions remain shielded.

---

## Technical Stack & Approach

**Architecture**
- **Frontend:** React / Next.js + TypeScript for dashboard and merchant integration.  
- **Backend:** Node.js / Express or Next.js API routes.  
- **Blockchain Access:** Zcash node or LightwalletD instance capable of scanning transactions using viewkeys.  
- **Data Storage:** Lightweight DB (PostgreSQL or Redis) for caching verified transactions.  
- **Security:** Encrypted storage for viewkeys; HTTPS-only API; no spending keys exposed.  

**Workflow**
1. Merchant generates a **shielded z-address**.  
2. Merchant provides a **viewkey** to the verifier tool (or keeps it in a secure environment).  
3. Verifier scans blockchain for transactions associated with the viewkey.  
4. Verifier returns confirmation details: amount, memo, and number of confirmations.  
5. Dashboard and API provide verification status for integration into merchant sites.

---

## Development Timing & Cost Estimate

**Hourly Rate:** USD 45/hr  
**Conversion:** 1 ZEC ≈ USD 600  

| Tool Component | Est. Hours | USD Cost | ≈ ZEC (USD ÷ 600) |
|----------------|------------|----------|------------------|
| Backend APIs (viewkey integration) | 40–50 hrs | \$1,800–\$2,250 | 3.00–3.75 ZEC |
| Frontend Dashboard | 30–40 hrs | \$1,350–\$1,800 | 2.25–3.00 ZEC |
| Sandbox/Test & Security | 20–25 hrs | \$900–\$1,125 | 1.50–1.88 ZEC |
| **Total Development** | 90–115 hrs | \$4,050–\$5,175 | 6.75–8.63 ZEC |
| Hosting (12 months @ \$25/mo) | N/A | \$300 | 0.50 ZEC |
| **Grand Total (Dev + Hosting)** | N/A | **\$5,475 USD** | **8.72 ZEC** |

---

## Deliverables & Timeline

| Week | Focus | Deliverables |
|------|--------|--------------|
| **Week 1 (Days 1–5)** | Backend API & viewkey integration | Fully functional blockchain scanning with viewkey; REST API endpoints |
| **Week 2 (Days 6–10)** | Frontend Dashboard | Dashboard for merchants to check verified transactions, memos, and confirmations |
| **Week 3 (Days 11–15)** | Security & Testing | Secure viewkey storage, caching, API rate limiting, documentation, demo |

⏱ **Total Calendar Duration:** ~3 weeks (~90–115 active dev hours)

---

## Deployment, Hosting & Running Cost
- Hosting: **\$25/month × 12 months = \$300**, includes API server and minimal DB for caching verified transactions.  
- Viewkeys stored encrypted; no spending keys exposed.  
- Tool designed to scale as merchant adoption grows.

---

## Delivery Assurance & Risk Clause
To ensure **guaranteed delivery** and reliability:  

- **Incremental Milestones:** Backend API first, then dashboard, then security + caching. Each milestone includes testing and QA verification.  
- **Security Audits:** Encrypted storage of viewkeys, no spending keys exposed, API rate limits, and HTTPS-only endpoints.  
- **QA Checks:** Every verified transaction tested against testnet before production deployment.  
- **Monitoring:** Backend and node monitored for uptime and transaction indexing.  

**Price Volatility Clause:**  
- The USD-ZEC conversion in this proposal is based on 1 ZEC ≈ \$600.  
- If the ZEC price falls drastically (>20%) before or during project funding, we will reserve the right to **adjust USD grant request proportionally** to maintain feasibility without reducing scope or quality.

---

## Summary & Funding Request

I request a **grant of \$5,475 USD** (≈ **8.72 ZEC**) to develop, deploy, and host the **Viewkey-Powered Zcash Payment Verifier** for 12 months.  

This tool will allow shielded ZEC payments to be verified safely, preserving privacy while enabling merchant confidence in adoption.

---

### ✅ Summary Snapshot

| Metric | Estimate |
|--------|-----------|
| Total Build Time | 90–115 hours (~3 weeks) |
| Total Cost | \$5,475 USD (≈ 8.72 ZEC) |
| Hosting | \$25/month × 12 months = \$300 |
| Core Stack | Next.js, Node.js, TypeScript |
| Hosting | Vercel / Render / AWS |
| Deliverables | Web dashboard + API for shielded transaction verification via viewkey |
| Guarantee | Incremental milestones, QA, security audits, monitoring |

---

**Thank you for considering this proposal.**  
This tool provides a **privacy-preserving verification solution** for shielded Zcash transactions, enabling real-world adoption while staying true to Zcash’s core privacy principles.

proposal.title: ZNodes Explorer - Real Time Network Map For Zebra & Zcashd
proposal.description:
## Application Info

**Owner:** @SafeguardLabs
**Organization:** Safeguard Labs
**Category:** Infrastructure
**Requested Amount:** $9,850 USD

## How we learned about ZCG

We learned about Zcash through some videos from the privacy community. When we started digging more into it we realized the community is pretty welcoming and the tech behind it is solid. Thats how we ended up here applying for a grant.

## Project Lead

Im a developer with background in blockchain - mainly Zcash, Algorand and Ethereum. I do smart contracts in Solidity and been working with privacy tech like Aleo (ZK proofs stuff).

For languages I use Rust, Golang, Python, Node.js and React. Built e-commerce platforms and cloud systems before. Right now also getting my OffSec certification because security is important for this kind of work.

## Project Summary

Ok so basically we're building a platform that shows all the healthy Zcash nodes to the community. Think of it like Bitnodes but for Zcash. We want to show both Zebra and Zcashd nodes.

The way it works is we took the Ziggurat crawler (the one Equilibrium Labs made) and we modified it because the original config had some issues for what we needed. We added filters to clean up the data and show only the nodes that actually work.

## The Problem

Right now when you look at Zcash network data theres a lot of noise. You see nodes that dont work, Flux nodes mixed in, nodes that arent synced properly. The community cant really see the real health of the network.

Also with Zebra transition happening we need to track how many nodes are moving over. If we dont know the real numbers we could have a centralization problem without even knowing it.

The Zcash Foundation made changes so you can see health of your own node, but with this platform we can make sure the whole ecosystem is decentralized - like checking if nodes are all in one location or spread out.

## What We Built So Far

We already have a working prototype at https://znodes.live

We forked the Ziggurat crawler from Equilibrium Labs and made several modifications:

**New data structures we added:**
- NodeInfo - stores info for each node like ip, port, user_agent, height
- NetworkStats - network statistics with total nodes, zcashd count, zebra count, flux count
- NodesResponse - the RPC response combining stats and node list

**Filtering logic we implemented:**
- Check if node responded to VERSION handshake (must have user_agent)
- User agent must start with /MagicBean or /Zebra
- Exclude anything with "flux" in user_agent
- Exclude MagicBean 6.x (thats Flux not real Zcash)
- Height must be above 2,000,000 (mainnet)
- Height must be within ±50,000 of estimated tip

**New RPC methods:**
- getnodes - returns filtered node list
- getstats - returns network statistics

**Other changes:**
- Added CORS support so frontend can connect
- Changed initial connection to warn instead of panic if it fails
- Added nodes snapshot that gets shared with RPC server

## Why These Filters Matter

Without filters you see like 500+ nodes but most are Flux. Flux nodes run MagicBean 6.x and they announce themselves on Zcash network but theyre not really Zcash nodes - theyre a different project.

With our filters we get around 150-200 nodes which matches what ZecHub and other sources report as the real Zcash network size.

## Solution Format

- Web platform running 24/7 on a VPS
- Open source code so anyone can verify the methodology
- Can run locally too if someone doesnt trust the public site
- Frontend dashboard showing cleaned data
- Public API for other projects to consume

## Dependencies

- Ziggurat crawler from Equilibrium Labs (base code we modified)
- VPS for 24/7 running (need good specs because crawler maintains thousands of connections)
- GeoIP database for map feature (to show where nodes are located)
- Zcash protocols (zcashd and Zebra) for handshakes

## Technical Approach

We use Rust because thats what Ziggurat is written in and it interacts directly with Zcash P2P protocol. The crawler makes handshake connections with nodes, we filter the data, and send it to a web interface.

The process:
1. Crawler connects to DNS seeds and discovers nodes
2. For each node we do VERSION handshake
3. We extract user_agent, height, protocol version
4. We classify as zcashd, zebra, or flux
5. We filter out flux and nodes that dont meet criteria
6. We send cleaned data to frontend via RPC

## What We Still Need To Do

- Add global map showing node locations (using GeoIP)
- Improve frontend design to be more professional
- Add support for manual node submission
- Add historical data tracking
- Better documentation

## Upstream Opportunities

Since we modified Ziggurat code we can make PRs back if we find bugs or improvements. Also if our crawler finds issues specifically affecting Zebra nodes we can share that with Zcash Foundation.

## Budget

| Item | Cost |
|------|------|
| VPS 12 months (32GB RAM, NVMe) | $1,450 |
| Domain + Security | $200 |
| Frontend Development | $4,000 |
| Backend Engineering | $2,500 |
| 12 month maintenance | $1,700 |
| **Total** | **$9,850** |

## Hardware Justification

Running a crawler needs higher specs than a regular node. We maintain thousands of concurrent connections to map the network, so we need 16-32GB RAM to prevent memory issues. Also need NVMe storage for fast data access.

## Risks

**Technical Risk (Low):** We already have working MVP so execution risk is low. About 50% of backend is done.

**Operational Risk:** Crawlers can trigger abuse mechanisms at hosting providers. We budget for tolerant hosting and will use rate-limiting.

## Privacy Considerations

We wont publish raw IP addresses of residential nodes. Geographic data will be aggregated to city/country level only. We want transparency without doxxing node operators.

## Success Metrics

1. Dashboard launch with Zcashd vs Zebra visualization
2. Greater than 99% uptime over 12 months
3. Open source code published for community auditing

## Startup Funding

Requesting $5,000 upfront (about 50%) because:
- Need to pay VPS for full year upfront
- Frontend developer needs retainer to start sprint
- Backend is already 50% done so we can move fast

## Milestones

**Milestone 1 - $2,425 - January 2026**
- Production dashboard launch
- Ziggurat crawler on VPS
- Data visualizations (heatmap, node counts, zebra vs zcashd breakdown)
- Public API release

**Milestone 2 - $2,425 - January 2027**
- 12 month service operations
- Protocol compatibility updates for any network upgrades
- Open source repository with documentation
- Final network health report

## Links

- **Live MVP:** https://znodes.live
- **Source Code:** https://github.com/Social-Mask-Labs/znodes
- **Forum Post:** https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/znodes-explorer-real-time-network-map-for-zebra-zcashd/53548

proposal.title: (UPDATED) Znodes Explorer: A Privacy-First Network Map for Zcash
proposal.description:
# Znodes Explorer: A Privacy-First Network Map for Zcash

## Background

Hello ZecHub, I am **Safeguard Labs**. I am deeply passionate about privacy, the hacking culture, and the entire blockchain ecosystem. My background is technical and diverse; I have "proof of knowledge" working with **Rust, Golang, Python, PHP, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS**.

I have previously built marketplaces using cryptocurrencies for payments and developed systems for the **Algorand** ecosystem. I also have experience with **Aleo**, which reinforced my enthusiasm for zero-knowledge technologies.

I am here because I find Zcash to be something beautiful and interesting. I want to contribute to this ecosystem by building a tool that can bring real value. I have already developed an MVP called **Znodes**, a website that uses a "handshake" process to discover new nodes. Currently, it functions as a Zcash node finder specifically for **Zebra** nodes. We are now ready to upgrade this to fully support **Zcashd** nodes as well.

This tool is essential for investors and the community to analyze the network's health: Is it centralized? Are nodes concentrated in one country? While Zcash provides transactional privacy, the health of the network itself should be transparent and public.

## Why this is important?

The spark for this project came from a comment by a Zcash Foundation worker who stated that [visualizing the network is a "great idea"](https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/where-are-all-the-zcash-nodes-exploring-a-simple-clear-view-of-the-network/53266). I investigated further and noticed that while there is curiosity about this, previous threads were closed, and no robust tool exists yet.

I decided to take the initiative. I utilized the **Ziggurat crawler**, modified it, and created custom filters to build my own solution.

There is a lot of data and repositories out there, but no one is unifying them into a user-friendly tool like **Bitnodes** (but for Zcash). My project solves this. With my updated crawler, we can:

* **Monitor Decentralization:** Prove that Zcash isn't a "crypto scam" but a robust, distributed network with many participants.
* **Track the Migration:** Visualize the transition from **Zcashd** to **Zebra**, seeing in real-time how the ecosystem's behavior evolves.
* **Ensure Stability:** Detect if the network is having node propagation issues.

## Proposal

I am requesting a grant of **$9,850** to fund 3 months of focused development to turn the MVP into a professional, fully-featured platform.

### Key Features & Goals

* **The Crawler:** We will improve the backend logic (based on Ziggurat) to discover both Zebra and Zcashd nodes efficiently.
* **Privacy-Preserving Live Map:** We will implement a live map showing node locations. **Crucially**, this will only show the *country* or general control region. We will **not** doxx node operators; exact locations will remain private.
* **Professional Design (UI/UX):** We will hire an external designer to create a "White & Professional" interface (utilizing a palette of black, strong blues, and grays). The goal is a clean platform with no ads, unlike Bitnodes.
* **Node Trust System:** A backend system to classify nodes based on stability and uptime, giving a "trust score."
* **Manual Node Discovery:** A feature allowing users to manually add their nodes to the platform to speed up discovery.
* **API for Developers:** A public API so other devs can use our node data for their own apps.
* **Security Audits:** Ensuring the site does not keep logs, IPs, or cookies that could compromise user privacy.

> **Budget Note:** I am currently using my personal Digital Ocean credits (student credits) to host the VPS, but I need those for other learning projects. This budget will cover dedicated VPS hosting, a premium domain, and maintenance.

---

## Roadmap & Milestones (3 Months)

**Total Budget Request:** $9,850

### Month 1: Infrastructure & Zcashd Integration ($5,000)
* Payment for dedicated VPS and Domain.
* Launch a secondary investigation node to analyze network behavior (solving the issue where some nodes receive info but don't send it).
* **Core Task:** Full integration of **Zcashd** support into the crawler.
* **Delivery:** A stable backend capable of seeing both Zebra and Zcashd nodes.

### Month 2: Live Map & Visual Overhaul ($3,000)
* Implementation of the **Real-Time Node Map** (Country-level precision).
* UI/UX Development: Implementing the new professional, white/clean design.
* Continued investigation of node behavior to refine the crawler's accuracy.

### Month 3: Advanced Features & Polish ($1,850)
* **Manual Node Adding:** Interface for users to submit nodes.
* **Backend Classification:** System to identify stable vs. unstable nodes.
* **API Release:** Documentation and endpoints for the public API.
* **Security Audit:** Final check to ensure no data leaks (IPs/cookies).

---

## Links & Resources

* **Live MVP:** [znodes.live](https://znodes.live)
* **Source Code:** [GitHub - znodes](https://github.com/Social-Mask-Labs/znodes)
* **Forum Discussion:** [Zcash Community Forum](https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/znodes-explorer-real-time-network-map-for-zebra-zcashd/53548)

The MVP has already been running for **100+ hours** without issues. With this grant, we can take it to the next level.

proposal.title: Zcash Developers Bootcamp by Nesthub
proposal.description:
NESTHUB comes from the need for a place where Web3 global professionals are being built and groomed in the city of Ibadan(the largest city in West Africa). As the first free physical developer training community in Ibadan, Nesthub is widely known as the leading developer education community among the tech community in Ibadan and has had a major influence on the growth of the members of the Web3 community in Ibadan. Nesthub has a lasting relationship with the Department of Computer Science, University of Ibadan(UI), Google developers on campus, UI, and similar relationships with 3 other universities in the southwestern part of Nigeria.
In Q2 2025, a couple of expert blockchain developers joined us to provide a highly curated, deep-dive session for our cohorts, which has helped our trainees gain a wide range of experience necessary for their journey. We have helped onboard blockchain developers for different blockchains like ICP and Stellar from our community.
A few of our previous cohorts' pictures : https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-aaq1lYgN-zIDui8CY9Xr-8DQnUbsqPw


Before founding Nesthub in 2024, young developers had very few accessible ways to learn the skills needed to build in Web3. Resources were scattered, unstructured, and often out of reach, creating a major gap between interest and real technical ability. Although new initiatives are beginning to create learning communities and provide hands-on guidance, they remain too limited to meet the growing demand for skilled blockchain developers. Nesthub has positioned itself as a solid bridge for young minds by expanding and simplifying these IRL programs, which is essential to equipping more young Nigerians with practical skills and open pathways into a rapidly growing global industry. It has also been observed that there are fewer educational initiatives in Nigeria concerning the topic of privacy solutions. It has also being realize thatost developers couldn't participate in hackathon (zypherpunk) involving privacy due to lack of knowledge. Most developers build products with little or no knowledge of how privacy works.

NestHub plans to leverage its established community, relationships, and partnerships to deliver a structured, privacy-focused community education initiative in Q1 2026 through the month-long developer cohorts and monthly meetups.
Two events: 1 Developer Cohorts, and 1 meetup for Zcash:

Developer bootcamp: January 2026
Meetup: 31st January 2026

Requested amount: $3500

>Facility Costs (Internet, electricity, and Audio and Video equipment) → $3000; 

>Meetup → $500

If Approved, we plan to spread the word of zcash Privacy with this bootcamp. NWith a solid curriculum that has been drafted, we have decided to have 2 senior developers. We also plan to open the bootcamp to not just our student but to the general public with the necessary skillset who might be interested in understanding how privacy works. 


Deliverables:
    - Host a month-long developer cohort on privacy focused solutions.
    - Host a meetup focused on Zcash and Privacy
    - pictures and videos taken during the events.


If you have any questions concerning this proposal 
Please reach me @ Telegram: DreKal0

proposal.title: Project Update & Request for Feedback: ZNodes
proposal.description:
**Hello Zechub this proposal is to ask you for some feedback on my project.**

To be honest, 2 days ago I decided to stop the development. But in those 2 days, I thought a lot about the progress of my project. I realized I have done a lot, and I really want to continue with it.

### Update on progress
I made the map, I added the map, and I updated the website.
You can see the code in the repository here: https://github.com/Jules0x-xyz/Znodes-Crawler-Zcash

### My Goal
I want to ask for a grant to improve the website and make a product that can be used by all the users of the Zcash ecosystem. **But before I ask for a grant, I want to receive all your feedback.**

I saw the Zechub opinion of my project and you said that you need more feedback. Also, looking at the reasons why you rejected my previous proposal helps me a lot. I want to know specifically the reasons to make corrections and make a product that adapts to your feedback for a new proposal.

### Specific Questions for You
In the videocall you made, I listened to someone saying that there exists a repository of a crawler, I heard the name is "cruch" or something like that but I made an investigation and I didn't find it. I am interesting to see more of that repository you mentioned.

**Please, I want to listen to all of your comments.**
I want to know the aspects that I need to clarify or the aspects I need to update to make another proposal.

You can write your questions here in this post:
https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/hello-zechub-responding-to-the-video-feedback-znodes-q-a/53742

I am going to answer everything there.

I know I said I wanted to leave this project or take some time, but the truth is I already have a big part done and I have a lot of anxiety/excitement to see this work. I want to achieve one of my first big contributions to Zcash.

Also, this project helps me distract myself and I feel it has a real purpose. I did this with a lot of effort and heart. I hope it doesn't bother you that I changed my mind and returned to work so fast.

**I am here to receive all your comments.**
You can ask questions about the development, the form that I made the project, the internal aspects, or the social aspects. I know that all the members of this DAO have different skills that improve the management and the projects, and I want that feedback to make a bigger and better panorama :) .

**Thanks for your time i wish i could receive a lot of feedback of you <3 **

proposal.title: Retroactive Grant Proposal
proposal.description:
**Project:** Zcash Ukraine Regional Community Initiative
**Coordinator:** Beyond
**Requested Amount:** **1 ZEC (retroactive)**
**Period Covered:** **December 2025**

---

### Background

Zcash Ukraine has been building a Ukrainian-speaking regional community around **Zcash** since June 2025, with a focus on practical adoption of private digital payments, financial privacy education, and grassroots community growth.

In late 2025, we applied for the **Zcash Ukraine Regional Community Initiative (Dec 2025 – Feb 2026)** grant. The proposal narrowly missed approval by **only 0.3%**, despite strong alignment with ecosystem goals and positive community feedback.

Importantly, **this result did not stop our work**.

---

### Continued Work Without Funding (December 2025)

Despite the absence of approved funding, we **fully continued operations throughout December 2025**, maintaining momentum and delivering tangible value to the Zcash ecosystem.

All activities were executed at our own expense and time commitment.

A detailed public report is available here:
👉 [https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcash-ukraine-monthly-report-december-1-31-2025/54059](https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcash-ukraine-monthly-report-december-1-31-2025/54059)

---

### Work Performed & Results (December 2025)

**Community & Content**

* Consistent activity across **Telegram, Twitter/X, Instagram, Threads, LinkedIn**
* Dozens of educational and informational posts
* Localized Ukrainian-language content focused on:

  * Zcash privacy fundamentals
  * Shielded transactions
  * Wallet security
  * Practical ZEC usage

**Educational Output**

* Multiple original articles and localized weekly digests
* Continued SEO groundwork for long-term discoverability
* Educational focus aligned with ZecHub and global Zcash messaging

**Zec UA Website**

* Ongoing development and content population
* First wave of traffic and organic discovery
* Over **500 unique visitors** in December

**Community Growth**

* Steady increase in followers and engagement despite no paid promotion
* Sustained trust and visibility within the Ukrainian crypto and activist space

---

### Why a Retroactive Grant Is Justified

* ✅ Work was **fully completed and publicly documented**
* ✅ Activities directly supported **Zcash adoption, education, and visibility**
* ✅ The original proposal narrowly missed approval by **only 0.3%**
* ✅ The team demonstrated **commitment, resilience, and accountability**
* ✅ No retroactive compensation has yet been received for this period

This retroactive request is **not speculative — it compensates **already delivered value.

 Retroactive Request

We respectfully request a retroactive grant of 1 ZEC as symbolic and partial compensation for the work executed in December 2025, during the originally proposed grant period.

This amount reflects:

* Community-first execution despite lack of funding
* Alignment with Zcash values of resilience and decentralization
* Continued contribution to regional adoption under difficult conditions



About the Coordinator

Beyond — digital security & privacy educator, Web3 community organizer, and coordinator of Zcash Ukraine
Focus areas include financial privacy, grassroots adoption, education, and regional ecosystem growth.


Closing

With this retroactive grant, the Zcash community acknowledges not only results, but also **commitment and integrity**.
Zcash Ukraine remains dedicated to expanding privacy, digital freedom, and practical ZEC usage in Ukraine.

Thank you for your consideration.

proposal.title: Zcash Ghana Community (February 2026 – April 2026)
proposal.description:
Project Description: The Zcash Ghana driving focus is to continue onboarding Ghanaians crypto users and businesses to the Zcash blockchain through its mission of blockchain education and financial privacy. This project started officially on June 30th 2025 with the creation of its X (twitter) handle @ZcashGH, where contents promoting Zcash and financial privacy were posted. Also we have been able to host 5 X-Space events and 4 physical meetups where we educated over 200 persons about Zcash and onboard them to Zcash through the creation of their Zcash wallets. At the moment our X page (@ZcashGH) has over 300 followers.

The Goal is to continue building an active Zcash Ghana community across various cities in Ghana. Educate Ghanains about Zcash’s privacy features and real-world applications. Increase the accessibility of Zcash-related content through localization and translation. Enhance user engagement through interactive activities, contests, and webinars. Encourage discussions on blockchain privacy and financial security within Ghana and ensuring wider adoption and understanding of privacy-focused blockchain technology in Ghana and Africa at large. Foster collaborations between Zcash and regional blockchain developers to create new privacy-focused solutions.

The reason for this grant: We are asking for this grant to help us continue building the Zcash Ghana community through our various blockchain education and financial privacy activities which include content creations, educational gaming, meetups and workshops, as well as collaborate with other web3 communities, all these leading towards more adoption of Zcash protocol in Ghana. With this grant we will host monthly Zcash Ghana physical meetup, monthly X-Space event and monthly game challenge together with educational content posts.


Expected Deliverables:
1. One monthly Zcash Ghana in-person meetup
2. One monthly Zcash Ghana x-space conversation
3. Zcash related content posting on X (twitter)

Past work: https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcash-ghana-meetup-1-onboarding-to-zcash/51917

https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/join-the-zcash-ghana-x-space-event-02-why-zcash-exploring-shielded-payments-business-potential/51648

https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/zcash-ghana-key-activities-update-december-2025/53793

https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/join-the-maiden-zcash-ghana-x-space-event-this-sunday/51597


Requested amount for 3 months: 4500 USD (1500 USD per month)

Conclusion: Zcash Ghana will serve as a vital hub for Ghanaians to learn, engage, and participate in the Zcash ecosystem. By combining content creation, community management, and strategic outreach, towards executing our mission of blockchain education and financial privacy for the activation of an active community dedicated to Zcash and its mission.

Thank you.

proposal.title: Improving ZecHub’s Contributor Pipeline & Education Distribution
proposal.description:
1. Context

ZecHub has become a central touchpoint for Zcash education, documentation, and community-driven contributions. Through its website, newsletter, wiki, and content initiatives, it has successfully lowered the barrier to learning about Zcash and enabled community members to contribute to the ecosystem.

However, as Zcash adoption grows and education becomes increasingly important to the privacy narrative, the current contributor workflow shows structural limitations that reduce its ability to scale participation, distribution, and long-term contributor engagement.

This proposal outlines an evolution of ZecHub’s contributor model to better support identity-bound contributions, broader participation, and ecosystem-wide distribution, without fragmenting existing efforts.


2. Current Contributor Model (Observed Limitations)

At present, contribution primarily occurs through task-based workflows using Dework. While functional, this model introduces several challenges:

- No structured onboarding or verification:
Contributors can participate without prior education, alignment, or demonstrated understanding of Zcash.

- Anonymous or low-commitment participation
Tasks can be completed by individuals with little long-term attachment to the Zcash ecosystem, including repeat or duplicate accounts.

- Single-output task constraints
Many tasks allow only one assignee, limiting the diversity, reach, and creative expression of educational outputs.

- Centralized distribution
Completed work is typically published on ZecHub-owned platforms, reducing organic reach across social networks where crypto-native audiences already exist.

- Limited contributor progression
There is no clear pathway for contributors to grow, specialize, or deepen their involvement beyond one-off tasks.

These constraints result in underutilized community capacity and missed opportunities for broader education and narrative distribution.


3. Identified Need

Zcash requires:

- Consistent, accurate education across public channels

- Contributors who understand privacy, shielding, and protocol values

- Distributed narratives that reach users where they already are

- Participation models that reward long-term engagement over short-term task completion

An improved contributor framework should prioritize education, identity, and distribution as first-class components.


4. Proposed Evolution of the Contributor Framework

This proposal recommends enhancing ZecHub’s contributor program through the following principles:

A. Verified Contributor Onboarding

Introduce a structured onboarding process focused on:

- Zcash fundamentals

- Accurate information sources

- Contribution standards


Verification ties contributions to real social identities (e.g. Twitter/X, TikTok), reducing low-effort or duplicate participation.


B. Contest-Based Educational Bounties

- Shift selected educational tasks from single-assignee jobs to open contests.

- Encourage multiple contributors to create content simultaneously.

- Leverage contributors’ personal platforms for initial distribution.

- Curate and feature high-quality outputs on ZecHub channels.


This approach increases both output volume and distribution reach.


C. Participation-Based Incentives

Recognize contributors for:

- content creation

- event attendance

- community participation

Encourage long-term involvement rather than isolated submissions.


D. ZecHub as Curator

- ZecHub maintains editorial standards and accuracy.

- The community becomes the distribution engine.

- Education spreads organically while remaining aligned with protocol values.


5. Expected Outcomes

- Higher-quality, privacy-aligned educational content

- Increased visibility of Zcash across social platforms

- Stronger contributor retention and accountability

- A scalable contributor system aligned with decentralization principles


A detailed framework outlining contributor onboarding, verification, participation incentives, and tracking mechanisms is available as a supplementary document for review here: 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1twbinsqSC6vLDmB-kctuAfq7VwdmGMU-BNVLVLaLqmE/edit?usp=drivesdk


Closing

This proposal does not replace ZecHub’s existing role. It strengthens it. By evolving the contributor pipeline and distribution model, ZecHub can better support Zcash’s education needs while preserving cohesion across the ecosystem.

proposal.title: Zcash Ukraine Regional Community
proposal.description:
**Project:** Zcash Ukraine — Content & Community Hub
**Coordinator:** Beyond
**Period:** **February – April 2026 (3 months)**
**Requested Funding:** **1 ZEC per month (Total: 3 ZEC)**

### Introduction

**Zcash Ukraine** is a Ukrainian-language educational and community initiative focused on expanding awareness, understanding, and practical adoption of **Zcash**. Active since June 2025, the initiative builds consistent regional presence through localized content, education, and community engagement.

This proposal requests funding to support **ongoing content production, social media activity, article writing, and maintenance of the Zcash Ukraine Hub** over a three-month period.

### Why This Matters in Ukraine

Ukraine continues to face:

* war-driven economic instability
* increasing financial surveillance
* high demand for secure digital payments and privacy tools

At the same time, Ukraine has a strong base of:

* IT professionals
* freelancers
* volunteers and activists
* crypto-native users

**Zcash provides real-world value** in this context by enabling financial privacy, censorship resistance, and digital autonomy. However, adoption depends heavily on **clear, localized, and consistent education in Ukrainian**.


### Project Goals (February–April)

* Maintain a **stable Ukrainian-language Zcash presence**
* Educate users on privacy, shielded transactions, and safe ZEC usage
* Grow and maintain the **Zcash Ukraine Hub** as an entry point for newcomers
* Increase community engagement and trust
* Support organic onboarding of new ZEC users

### Scope of Work

#### 1. Social Media & Community Content

**Platforms:**

* Twitter / X
* Telegram
* LinkedIn

**Monthly output:**

* ~30–40 posts (news, educational posts, threads)
* Localized explanations covering:

  * Zcash privacy fundamentals
  * shielded transactions
  * wallet security
  * real-world ZEC use cases
  * ecosystem updates
* Polls, discussions, and community interaction
* Moderation and audience engagement

#### 2. Article Writing

* 2–3 in-depth educational articles per month
* Topics include:

  * financial privacy
  * digital security
  * practical Zcash usage
  * Web3 and privacy
* Written in Ukrainian
* Long-term educational and SEO-oriented value


#### 3. Zcash Ukraine Hub Maintenance

* Regular content updates
* Publishing and structuring educational materials
* Improving onboarding flow for new users
* Maintaining the Hub as a **regional Zcash education center**


### Expected Outcomes (3 Months)

* **90–120 social media posts**
* **6–9 original educational articles**
* Consistent engagement and audience growth
* Increased traffic to Zcash Ukraine Hub
* New ZEC users and stronger community presence
* Sustained Ukrainian-language visibility within the Zcash ecosystem


### Budget

| Item                                          | Amount               |
| --------------------------------------------- | -------------------- |
| Content creation, moderation, Hub maintenance | 1 ZEC / month        |
| Articles & educational materials              | included             |
| **Total**                                     | **3 ZEC (3 months)** |

The requested funding is **minimal and impact-focused**, covering direct execution rather than overhead.


### About the Coordinator

**Beyond** — digital security and privacy educator, Web3 community organizer, and coordinator of **Zcash Ukraine**, with hands-on experience in content production, community growth, and privacy education.


### Conclusion

This grant ensures **continuity and consistency** of Ukrainian-language Zcash education and outreach.
**1 ZEC per month** enables real, measurable contributions to adoption, awareness, and regional ecosystem growth.

Thank you for your consideration.

proposal.title: Zcash Global Ambassador Elzz (February - April 2026)
proposal.description:
Zcash Ambassador Tenure Renewal Proposal

Name: Elzz
Role: Zcash Global Ambassador
Tenure Covered: November 2025 – January 2026

Over the past three months, my ambassadorship has focused on one core objective:
moving people from awareness of Zcash to actual usage and sustained participation.

Rather than relying solely on passive education or awareness-driven content, my work has centered on experience-led community building: combining consistent educational content, live conversations, creating low-friction entry points and hands-on onboarding that allowed people to see and use Zcash in practice.

From micro-meetups and live Spaces to the #12DaysOfZECmas challenge and ongoing educational content, this tenure has demonstrated that adoption accelerates when people are invited to participate, not just observe.

This proposal outlines the impact of the work so far and why continuing this approach is important for the Zcash ecosystem moving forward.




Community Building & Onboarding

Throughout the tenure, I hosted two (2) focused meetups designed around live onboarding rather than abstract explanations. These sessions emphasized:

- Wallet setup and usage
- Shielded transactions
- Payments and swaps via Zashi
- Cross-chain usage through the Near Intent bridge


A consistent outcome across these meetups was the same moment of clarity: participants were often surprised by how simple and usable privacy felt once experienced directly. Many attendees continued engaging with the Zcash community afterward, contributing to ongoing discussions and activities.



Content, Spaces & Collaborative Education

Across the three months, I maintained a steady cadence of educational content and live discussions, publishing multiple protocol-focused articles and hosting a total of five X Spaces during the tenure.

These Spaces were intentionally collaborative, including sessions with Zcash Nigeria, Zcash Ghana, and ecosystem builders like Shielded Mark of Shielded Labs. This helped broaden reach, connect regional communities and reinforce shared narratives around privacy, usability, and adoption.

Content topics consistently focused on core Zcash principles: privacy, shielding, usability, and real-world application, and were often shaped directly by community questions and feedback. This created a feedback loop where curiosity informed education, and education led to participation.



Experience-Led Community Activation:

#12DaysOfZECmas Challenge 
One of the most impactful initiatives during this tenure was the #12DaysOfZECmas challenge, executed in December.
The challenge was designed to move beyond awareness by encouraging daily, hands-on interaction with Zcash tools, particularly Zashi.

Participants were guided through activities such as:
- Wallet setup
- Shielded payments
- Swaps and on-chain activity
- Joining community events (calls and spaces)
- Sharing real usage experiences publicly

The initiative generated strong community participation and demonstrated how effective experience-led onboarding can be for a privacy-focused protocol. It lowered psychological barriers, increased confidence, and created a shared moment of participation across the community.

The challenge gained ecosystem-wide visibility, including recognition in the then Zcash CEO Josh Swihart’s weekly update, validating the effectiveness of community-led, experience-driven adoption efforts.




Ecosystem Connectivity & Local Access

Beyond community education, I focused on addressing practical access gaps within the Zcash ecosystem.

During this tenure, I initiated direct outreach to Pajcash, a leading Nigerian on-ramp and off-ramp platform already active within the Solana ecosystem, to explore support for ZEC alongside existing fiat and crypto flows.

Following this outreach, Pajcash began active work toward enabling direct ZEC on-ramp and off-ramp to Nigerian Naira bank accounts, with an MVP currently in progress.
This represents a meaningful step toward improving local accessibility of ZEC in a key emerging market.



Past Reports

A quick glance through my work so far can be found on the Zcash community forum via these links:

https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/global-ambassador-elzz-november-2025-report/53601

https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/global-ambassador-elzz-december-2025-report/54021

https://forum.zcashcommunity.com/t/global-ambassador-elzz-january-2026-report/54522



Next Tenure Focus & Planned Deliverables

My focus for this tenure will be to consolidate the momentum built over the past three months and deepen hands-on participation within the Zcash ecosystem.

A key priority is the execution of the 3-day contributor and onboarding workshop scheduled for February 16–18, which has been under active planning. This workshop is designed to lower entry barriers for contributors by clarifying contribution pathways, reinforcing accuracy standards, and helping participants move from interest to meaningful participation within the ecosystem.

Beyond the workshop, ongoing efforts will continue to center around education, visibility, and real usage.

Deliverables for the next tenure include:

- Educational content (articles and short-form posts) focused on core Zcash concepts, tooling, and privacy narratives
- Regular X Spaces for live education, ecosystem discussions, and community Q&A, including collaborative sessions where relevant
- Continued hosting of onboarding meetups focused on practical Zcash usage (Zashi, shielding, cross-chain privacy)
- Active community engagement and follow-up with newly onboarded members to support sustained participation
- Continued outreach to ecosystem partners where opportunities improve access, usability, or local adoption

The objective is to continue translating curiosity into real usage and participation, using methods that have already proven effective within the Zcash community.


Budget

Maintaining previous budget of $1000/month = $3000 for three months (February, March, April 2026)




Conclusion

This tenure showed that Zcash adoption accelerates when education is paired with experience and community is built through participation.

Through consistent content, collaborative Spaces, hands-on meetups, and initiatives like #12DaysOfZECmas, this work helped lower barriers to privacy and turn interest into real usage.

By listening closely to community signals, collaborating across regional Zcash communities, and emphasizing practical onboarding through tools like Zashi and the Near Intent bridge, these efforts strengthened confidence, understanding and engagement. Renewing this ambassadorship allows this momentum to continue and compound, building on proven methods that are already working.

I’m grateful for the opportunity to continue serving the Zcash community and contributing to its long-term growth.

proposal.title: Zcash Luma Calendar Management
proposal.description:
Zcash Luma Calendar Management Proposal Renewal 

Name: UknowZork

Content Writer | Graphics Artist | Community Contributor
3–4 Years of Experience in Content Creation & Visual Communication

This proposal serves as a renewal of my previously approved calendar management role. I managed the Zcash Luma calendar from April 2025 through December 2025, during which I was responsible for maintaining event accuracy, improving ecosystem visibility, and ensuring consistent, reliable updates.

In addition to calendar maintenance, I also created and added visuals and graphics for events, helping improve presentation, recognition, and engagement across the Zcash community.

Impact & Metrics (April 2025 – December 2025)
(https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/17FkxDgNv_z1MwnYxHTEA0FnpdQ7RIwgs)

- 40 new calendar subscribers gained, with continued organic growth

- Regular addition of event visuals and branded graphics for community calls, AMAs, and recurring events

- Consistent, verified updates covering governance, development, protocol updates, and community events

- Improved discoverability and professionalism of the calendar through structured formatting and visuals

- Ongoing coordination with community members to ensure accuracy and timely inclusion

Technical Approach – Continued Calendar Management

Content Updates
I will continue adding relevant ecosystem events, including AMAs, community calls, governance discussions, protocol updates, and other Zcash-related activities.

Verification
All entries will be verified prior to publication, with event links, time zones, and descriptions carefully checked.

Consistency
Each entry will follow a uniform structure to maintain clarity, professionalism, and ease of navigation.

Visual & UX Enhancements

- EVENT VISUALS & GRAPHICS: I will continue creating or adapting simple, branded visuals for recurring and key events to enhance visibility and user engagement.

- CATEGORIZATION: Events will be organized under clear categories such as Development, Community, and Governance, improving usability and navigation.

COMMUNITY COORDINATION

- COMMUNICATION:I will actively liaise with developers, community leaders, and ecosystem partners to ensure events are submitted and published in a timely manner.

- FEEDBACKLOOP: Community feedback will be monitored and incorporated to refine formatting, visuals, and update cadence as needed.

TIMELINE

- This is an ongoing responsibility requiring weekly attention. The renewal period will follow a monthly cycle with weekly reviews, including:

- Weekly checks and updates

- Advance scheduling of confirmed events

- Visual and graphic touch-ups where applicable

- Coordination with Zcash social and community platforms when needed

Budget Proposal

I propose continuing this work at a flat monthly rate of $110, which covers:

- Calendar updates and event research

- Communication with stakeholders

- Creation and maintenance of event visuals and graphics

- Consistent formatting and verified updates for at least four weeks per cycle

CONCLUSION

Maintaining an accurate, visually organized, and consistently updated Zcash Luma calendar strengthens ecosystem awareness and participation. Based on my contributions from April–December 2025, measurable subscriber growth, and ongoing visual improvements, I am confident this renewal will continue to provide clear value to the Zcash community.

Thank you for your consideration.

proposal.title: Retroactive Grant Proposal – Zcash Luma Calendar Management (January)
proposal.description:
OVERVIEW: This proposal requests retroactive compensation for the month of January, during which I continued maintaining the Zcash Luma calendar despite the absence of active funding.

My previous proposal was structured for renewal this year, and due to an oversight on my part, I did not formally submit the renewal before the start of the new cycle. Under the assumption of continuity, I continued performing the role throughout January.

As a result, the calendar remained active and consistently maintained during that period without an active funding agreement in place.

Work Completed in January: Throughout January, I continued to:

- Add and update ecosystem events

- Verify dates, links, and time zones for accuracy

- Create and update event visuals and graphics

- Coordinate with community members for event submissions

- Maintain formatting consistency and categorization

There was no interruption in calendar updates or ecosystem visibility during the month.

IMPACT

- Weekly updates were maintained throughout January

- Community, governance, and development events were published and verified

- Visual assets continued to be created and updated

- The calendar remained organized, accurate, and accessible

- The ecosystem experienced no gap in event coordination or discoverability.

Funding Request: I am respectfully requesting retroactive compensation for January only, at the previously approved monthly rate of $110.

Accountability & Process Improvement: I take full responsibility for not submitting the renewal proposal before the start of the new funding cycle. While the continuation of work was done in good faith and aligned with prior responsibilities, I acknowledge that the formal renewal should have been completed in advance.

To prevent similar situations in the future, I will:

- Track proposal timelines and renewal dates more carefully

- Submit renewal requests prior to the end of each funding cycle

- Maintain clearer documentation of active funding periods

- My goal is to ensure full transparency, proper process alignment, and continued reliability in this role.

Conclusion: Maintaining an accurate and visually organized Zcash Luma calendar supports ecosystem coordination, event visibility, and community participation. Although the formal renewal was delayed, the work in January continued uninterrupted.

I appreciate the community’s consideration of this retroactive request and remain committed to maintaining a reliable and professional calendar for the Zcash ecosystem.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

proposal.title: DAO Membership Proposal – Contribution & Ongoing Commitment
proposal.description:
I am SpeedFox, an active contributor within the Zcash ecosystem and seek to formalize my involvement through DAO membership.

1. Ecosystem Contributions

My contributions span multiple domains that strengthen both technical infrastructure and community engagement:

a) Knowledge Infrastructure

I have contributed to the development and improvement of ZecHub (https://zechub.wiki), supporting structured documentation and educational resources.

Clear, accessible documentation is critical in a privacy-focused protocol like Zcash, where concepts such as shielded transactions, key management, and node operations require careful explanation. My contributions help lower onboarding friction for developers and users.

b) Creative & Educational Media

Beyond documentation, I have contributed graphics design and short-form video content to enhance educational outreach and ecosystem visibility.

High-quality visual communication is essential for:

 - Simplifying complex cryptographic concepts
 - Increasing social engagement
 - Supporting campaign initiatives
 - Strengthening brand consistency within the ecosystem

This aligns with long-term community growth objectives.

c) Infrastructure Support

I recently began operating:

 - A full Zcash node
 - A Lightwalletd instance

By running core infrastructure, I contribute directly to:

 - Network decentralization
 - Transaction relay robustness
 - Developer and wallet ecosystem reliability
 - Reduced dependency on centralized infrastructure providers

Infrastructure operators are foundational to protocol resilience, particularly in a privacy-preserving network where decentralization is a core value proposition.


2. Strategic Alignment with DAO Goals

My contributions align with key DAO priorities:

 - Decentralization — Running full node infrastructure
 - Education & Adoption — Contributing to ZecHub documentation
 - Community Growth — Visual and media support
 - Technical Depth — Hands-on experience operating Zcash infrastructure

This reflects not just passive participation but operational commitment.

3. Forward-Looking Intent

DAO membership would allow me to:

 - Participate more formally in governance discussions
 - Support technical and educational initiatives
 - Continue strengthening ecosystem infrastructure
 - Collaborate on tooling, documentation, and community-driven development

My objective is long-term contribution, not symbolic affiliation.

Thank you.

proposal.title: Animation contest for new server banner.
proposal.description:
## Proposal: Use the DAO treasury to create a competition to choose the new animated banner for the Zcash Global server created by the community. 

The goal of this contest is to make your community feel more unique and harmonious. Bring visibility to DAO and SubDAO, onboard new potential contributors as Zcash users. It also helps users quickly identify which server they are visiting and give someone the opportunity to receive in ZEC.

For this contest, the prize amount donated by SubDAO will be 250 JUNO from the treasury plus an amount in ZEC that will be requested for donations on free2z and in the community.

* Accept donations in Zcash Transparent via this address: 
#### t1Z28Y5cL5RyQD3tjFmjsmcp6sQ5aQCeDNQ 


## * The amounts donated above 10 ZECs will be returned half to the DAO treasury and the other half to SubDAO for community activations and task creation.

The donated amounts will be updated on my twitter: https://x.com/pedamerico

The banner animation or illustration may or may not contain a Zcash logo with a creative animation that shows the power of the community and the values that Zcash carries in its mission. There may be ZecHub logos involved and other community projects like ZK A/V or MFZ, but it is not mandatory to have a logo, the original focus should be on Zcash as Technology, Community, Human Rights, privacy and freedom.

Voting for Banners will be done by DAO and SubDAO Members, with each person having the same voting weight.

The competition will start from the approval of the proposal until June 25th. The winner will be announced in July with the Banner uploaded to the server.


# Banner Guidelines

- image or GIF of at least 960x540 pixels with an aspect ratio of 16:9.

- Keep the top first 48 pixels of the image free of too much information. This way, your server title will be easy to read for your community.

- Use a GIF that represents Zcash.

- Doing something beautiful and harmonious is important to make our home more beautiful and pleasant for new visitors.

proposal.title: Create Cross-Chain Account : Osmosis
proposal.description:
# Background
Osmosis is a fair-launched, customizable automated market maker (AMM) for interchain assets that allows the creation and management of non-custodial, self-balancing, interchain token index similar to one of Balancer.

https://github.com/osmosis-labs/osmosis

# Why?
As the goto DEX for anything IBC, having a DAO controlled Osmosis wallet will add flexibility while also further support the subDAO's needs.

# Proposal
This proposal, with majority approval, will create an account on the Osmosis chain, allowing this subDAO to perform actions with an Osmosis treasury wallet.

# Action
Creates an account on another chain, allowing this subDAO to perform actions on that chain.

proposal.title: MFZv2 Viral Video Contest
proposal.description:
Objective:
The purpose of this proposal is to request the transfer of 3 ZEC to the transparent address of the same Design SubDAO Wallet to hold a viral video contest, encouraging the creation of content about the book "My First Zcash".

The goal is to promote knowledge about Zcash in a creative and engaging way, focused on the Zcash community.

Contest Format:

Theme: The contest will be based on the creation of short videos for social networks about the book "My First Zcash".
Video Length: The video must have a minimum length of 30 seconds and a maximum of 1 minute.
Publishing Platform: Participants must post the videos on X, using the hashtags #MyFirstZcash and #Zcash.
Participants: The contest will be open to all members of the Design SubDAO, as well as any member of the Zcash community.
Video requirements: Since the book has not yet been translated, the videos must be focused on the English language. Videos with audio in another language will be accepted, with subtitles translated into English.

Prizes:
There will be 3 winners divided into the following categories: most viral video, best editing, best creativity. The amount raised will be divided, with a limit of 15 ZECs (5 ZECs for each winner). The remainder will be sent to the orchard pool for the DAO treasury.

Transparency:
To ensure transparency in the donation and prize process, we will disclose the transparent address of the SubDAO (where the value of 3 ZECs will be allocated after the proposal is approved), allowing the community to contribute the remaining 12 ZECs to fund the contest prizes.

Commitment:
I commit to developing all the graphic communication necessary for the campaign, ensuring that the contest is attractive and well-publicized, increasing community participation and engagement. The contest and voting end date will be announced only when it is ready and posted.

Final Thoughts:
I believe that this contest will not only stimulate the creativity of the participants, but will also promote the book "My First Zcash", contributing to the education and dissemination of Zcash. We thank you for considering this proposal and hope to count on the support of the Design SubDAO.

Best regards, Iogy.

proposal.title: Logo for Zkool New wallet
proposal.description:
> 1. Objective
> Create the Zkool wallet, a modern and secure Zcash management solution designed to replace Ywallet, incorporating multisig features. The design process will involve the design SubDAO members proposing logo models for community input (adds to the project with community-designed logo).

> 2. Main Features
> Zcash Wallet: User-friendly and secure interface.
> Multisig: Enhanced security with multiple signatures required for transactions.
> Collaborative Design: Community involvement in logo creation (adds to the project with the community's logo).

> 3. Development Process
> Phase 1: Design SubDAO members submit logo proposals.
> Phase 2: The wallet creator will select the logo based on representativeness, minimalism, and connection to Zcash and multisig.
> Phase 3: Implementation of the chosen logo in the wallet and communication materials.

> 4. Visual Elements Desired
> Remind of Zcash: Colors, symbols, or elements associated with Zero-Knowledge technology.
> Remind of multisig: Symbols representing multiple signatures, security, or collaboration.
> Minimalistic style: Clean, recognizable, simple for app use.

> 5. Design Guidelines
> Simple, modern shape.
> Possible inclusion of cryptography symbols, locks, or multiple keys.
> The color palette is open, but ideally aligned with conveying trust and technological innovation.

> 6. Guidelines by wallet creator: No AI things

> 4.5. ZEC
> The wallet will manage ZEC, the native token of Zcash, as part of the SubDAO.`
 
> A defense of the logo design concept will be mandatory. (proof of concepts)

proposal.title: Transferring Treasury from Zechub SubDAO Design to Zechub DAO
proposal.description:
### Overview

As we approach the new year, I recognize my responsibility in moving forward, particularly since I was instrumental in creating the Zechub subDAO as well. With Zcash Brazil having its own design team, Spain and other communities actively participating in Dework, and given that Zechub has its own design team, we no longer need to manage the SubDAO's treasury or keep it operational.

I propose the transfer of the remaining treasury balance from the Design SubDAO to the main Zechub DAO. This transfer aims to consolidate resources and ensure efficient management of funds within the Zechub ecosystem.

### Current Treasury Details
- **Remaining Balance in Design SubDAO**: 19.04 ZECs
- **Pending Payment for Last Task**: 2.5 ZECs (to be disbursed in 2025)
- **Total Amount to Transfer**: 16.54 ZECs (after accounting for the final payment)

The last task involves the creation and delivery of a tutorial titled "Installing Zebrad Node on Linux." This task is scheduled for delivery on November 29, 2025, and will subsequently be posted on YouTube. For reference, the task details can be found here: [Task Link](https://app.dework.xyz/zechub-2424/project-space?taskId=a3302cfb-f3b7-4b78-863b-c05017a5d083).

### Transfer Process
If this proposal is approved:
- The receiving address for the Zechub DAO will be provided by Squireel.
